text: Simply put, Wes Kendrick is one of the best chefs in a city full of great chefs. This is high end American comfort food in a relaxed setting with great service. You won't find a better off-strip restaurant in Las Vegas.
Been here over a dozen times and never disappointed. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Try the bison if available!

We hit this lovely little spot as part of our RW tour of restaurants and were not dissappointed. This little gem is tucked away behind a Starbucks that I must've driven past 100 times and never noticed.

Service: We were seated promptly though the place was busy and we were 15 minutes early. Our waitress gave us some wonderful suggestions on what to order and she was extremely friendly. We did notice that the service slowed down around our main course and it took some time to get our dessert and pay our check but this would not deter me from returning. 

Food:  I ordered the duck confit quesadilla which came with a nice little salad and my sister the beet goat cheese salad as appetizers; both were delicious though I would pick the duck over the salad since it is not something you find very often and it was super tasty. For our main courses I ordered the signature baby back ribs with the tasty molasses glaze, it was falling off the bone and delicious. My sister went with the butternut squash ravioli which we had both been eyeing but turned out to be disappointing as the pasta was under cooked and the filling was bland; the sauce however was wonderful. For dessert I went with the peanut butter pie, it was extremely rich but so good and the honey comb clusters really topped it wonderfully. Again my sister got the short end of the stick as she went with the lemon cheesecake that was mediocre compared to my peanut butter goodness though fine if you aren't comparing it to the other dessert.

Been here a few times for lunch, it's always busy and challenging to grab a table.  Once seated you will understand why there is a long wait.  The food is great with a unique menu, great energy and fair prices.  If you haven't tried this place check it out.

I have been to Table 34 several times and have had consistently good service and excellent food.  There was  one time that the wrong dish was brought to me, and the staff bent over backwards to remedy the situation.  Slightly on the pricey side, but there are a lot of relatively inexpensive options such as pizza and pasta.   Get there early, and there is no wait for a table.   Restaurant is off the beaten track and sometimes hard to find, but it is well worth the effort.

Great place to have a nice meal at lunch. I wouldn't call this casual. Lots of suits for lunchtime. The food quality was fantastic. Had the beet and goat cheese salad, a cup of lamb chili and the pork chop entree. The service was top notch, and the meal just kept building and getting better. Enjoy!

We tried this restaurant for lunch at a friend's recommendation.  It was excellent; so we tried it for dinner.  It is now our favorite place.  The atmosphere is perfect; the wait staff is wonderful, and the food is perfect.  My husband always orders the C.A.B. tenderloin medium well.  It comes out tender and delicious--not an easy task for any chef!  We have never been disappointed with the food, and the desserts are sensational, too.

It's restaurant week! What better excuse to try out a new local restaurant? After a very careful review of all of the participating restaurants on the 3 square list, I decided to try out Table 34. 

The restaurant itself is tucked away in a corner, in a strip of shops. I probably never would have noticed it driving by, but it is definitely a hidden gem. I made a 7:30 reservation, and arrived a little bit early, so we waited at the bar until our table was ready. The bar is small, with just 8 chairs and a television, but it is cute and we were able to grab some chairs and have a glass of wine. 

One of the reasons I chose this restaurant was because they have such a large selection of options for their restaurant week menu. I ordered the duck quesadillas, the short ribs and the ice cream sundae, while my fiancé ordered the beet and goat cheese salad, macaroni and cheese, and the peanut butter pie. 

I can't pick a favorite out of everything we ordered, because it was all amazing. The sauce on my quesadillas was yummy, my ribs were falling off the bone tender, the macaroni was some of the best macaroni I have ever had, and the desserts were both awesome! We were extremely happy with all of our choices. We went our compliments back to the kitchen, and the chef personally came out to our table to thank us. 

As an overall  experience, we had a great time here. The atmosphere is fun and elegant without being stuffy, the food is top notch, and I love how much care and love that obviously goes into the menu and the food. I can't wait to go back and try some more dishes!

Our first visit to Table 34, and definitely not the last.  Good service, altho our server's accent was a little difficult to understand,  but we got through it.  Restaurant not too big, so not noisy, which is a definite plus,and loved the subdued lighting.  Oh, yes, and our food was great!  A little pricey, but executed beautifully and a wide, varied selection. We'll definitely be back, with friends!
I can't recall the servers name but this place was great! The Mac n cheese was delicious and the salmon is one of my favorites! Il definitely be back
This is a great local's favorite and a hidden gem ! The ambiance is lovely , the food is fresh and consistent and service is impeccable . Try it , you will be glad you did ....

Went in expecting a great dine in experience and came out very disappointed. The only reason I gave it 1 star was due to the excellent service our waiter showed. I had the trout and was very disappointed. The fish had 1) no flavor whatsoever 2) it was drenched in oil. I may not be a executive chef, but for a customer who's paying $30 a plate, I would expect it to taste half decent.

What a hidden gem.. we drive by this on Warm Springs and never took advantage of the wonderful food and terrific, friendly service. Went to lunch today and such a pleasant surprise. Mr had the corn beef rueben and I had a special of lobster cakes (loaded with lobster) and a bowl of acorn squash soup with a small mini muffin (so tasty I could have made a meal of those too).
 Our ice teas never got below half way .. they were great at refilling. 

We WILL be back  ..

I have been a solid fan and customer of Table 34 from its inception as Wild Sage, through its closing and to its reincarnation.  The food has always been delicious and good, but not memorable.  What kept me going there was the service and the feeling that somehow it was a special gem off of the strip.  The Chef never stopped by, but it was the service staff that was so nice.  I always went for dinner usually with guests, spending a goodly sum.  But, today I have ended that relationship, all because the restaurant would not reserve a table for a special birthday lunch.  It was explained that it is a rush hour pace, and so I should have no problem getting in and out.  That wasn't quite the ambience I was hoping for.  Glad that lunch is busy, but they could have made an exception for a long standing customer looking for a special experience.  I guess it wasn't that special after all.
Had lunch here with my co worker for the first time, and man I tell you everything I had was well proportioned and taste great, a little pricy but you get what you paid for
The food was amazing. I had a Mac n cheese with a side of veggies. The desserts are amazing as well. Great service.
We tried the fish and chips.  The fish was very heavily breaded and soaked in grease from the fryer - gave me a stomache ache :(
Very nice, yet still casual.   Burger quite delicious.   That is all
Chef Wes is the ABSOLUTE BEST!!! Always a FABULOUS dining experience when we go!! Atmosphere is superb and the food is ALWAYS PHENOMENAL!!!

Friendly, quiet, amazing food, and decent price - this is about as good as I've found in Vegas. I came here upon the recommendation of a friend who has been hit or miss with recommendations in the past. When I first drove up it looked dark inside but they were open - on a Saturday night at 5 they were barely busy - only 4 tables had guests. Lucky for us that ment the service was prompt and attentive.
The specials they had that night were Bison, Ribs, and some sort of fish dish. I got the bison and the girlfriend had the ribs. What came out was two heaping platefuls of heaven. Bison was cooked to perfection - charred on outside but medium rare on inside and had a perfect amount of gremalade (sp?). It came with an amazing rizzoto/truffle pilaf and some vegetables. I practically licked my plate clean with how great it was. 
It had nothing though in comparison to the girlfriend's dish. The plate was overflowing with ribs, fries, coleslaw, and even a slice of watermelon. The fries were of a creole variety which tasted kinda like seasoning salt with a little extra something. The coleslaw was about two scoop fulls and pretty good by itself. The Ribs though - wow - they were of some honey glazed bbq variety and they were literally falling off the bone. You literally could pull the bone out clean. They had an incredible smoky flavor. The chef outdid himself on these.
I'll definitely be back again to try out some of their specials and menu items.  They even had some of my favorite wines in stock as well. This is such a great tucked away place in Vegas that offered an incredible dining experience for a reasonable price.

We have been fans of Wes Kendrick since this place was Wild Sage. When it closed, we were devastated. And when it reopened as Table 34, we were ecstatic!!! Wes has "eclectic American" food style down perfectly. His staff is great, and you can tell they all enjoy their jobs. This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas, and I hope it stays here for a long, long time.

Looking for a nice meal without going into Las Vegas craziness, we found Table 34. What a great find! The service and presentation were excellent, the food delicious, the wine list quite nice. 

My mother had a glass of Fume Blanc that the waiter came along and refilled. I enjoyed a glass of Duckhorn's Decoy. Her buffalo shrimp was delightfully spicy, and the beet salad was fresh and "scrumptious" - her description. 

My linguine with chicken and spinach in a garlic cream sauce was tasty and filling. Highly recommend for price, service, presentation, and, of course, the food. 

Almost forgot, the creme brûlée was perfect. Very charming manager/owner made sure we had a good experience, as well.

What a gem of a local restaurant! Off-strip (huge bonus), fantastic service, delicious food and a convenient location. Went for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with both my fresh soup and entree sized salad. I'd recommend their smoked salmon, reportedly made in-house. The bread was a great way to kick off the meal too. I like that they add little surprises throughout the meal too: a scone / biscuit type bread to accompany the soup and buttery coconut macaroons as a little parting gift. 
I never would have thought to stop at Table 34 if a colleague had not recommended it. Business park strip malls are not usually go-to locations for good lunches. However, I will certainly go back!

We went here for the first time during resturant week.  We have nothing to say but good things about this place.  The service was great, the food was fantastic and the atmosphere was relaxing.  We will definately be back.  Thanks for a great evening out.
Great spot. Me and my girl love this place. Not sure if i can give any suggestions for improvement :)
My favorite Las Vegas restaurant.  Delicious food and first-rate service.

First time here and we will come back again. I had the short rib special, it literally melted in my mouth. I don't think I've ever eaten meat that was more tender. The restaurant is cozy and has a great energy, everyone was happy, professional and gracious. A great place for a date , friends or a business client dinner.

A great way to celebrate my 70th.....My friend Allen took me here. It's his favorite restaurant. I arrived a little early and had the chance to chat with Italian-born GM Toni who promised me a complimentary dessert. Then he introduced me to his wife and head waitress Janina. What a great pair! Their service and hospitality made my birthday special.....AND they gave me a VERY special birthday surprise!! The food was exquisite, the servings generous and I had something to take home. This is a hidden gem. Please say hello to my new friends when you come here for your special dinner or lunch.... Gary

I only write a review when a restaurant is unusually bad or unusually good. This place is fantastic in every way. 
I know roasted chicken is not the sexiest menu choice but mercy, that's the best chicken I've ever eaten. It's hard to get chicken right--there's a really fine line between dried out and raw. This was perfect. 
I overheard a gentlemen at the next table tell his server he was eating the best steak he'd ever had. 
The service was top notch... the atmosphere, fantastic. 
I know a lot of restauranteurs I'd like to bring to this place so they can see what a 5-star experience is like. 
The only negative--I'm here on business and live on the other side of the country.
Incredible food, ribs are great! Service is fantastic, I definitely would recommend this place !!!
I will get straight to the point...  best food in the city!  Service is really great too.
Crab cake special, just OK. Bacon and gouta pizza, very good. Good service, industrial park location. Nicer insider than you'd think. :) Too expensive for what it is :)

If you haven't been here yet, shame on you. I stay close to the airport when visiting dr out of town and Table 34 is walking distance from my hotel. I grab an early dinner, it's a downshift from the strip, and jump on a very early flight the Next morning . With that said, the eggplant is OUTSTANDING - no breading, no frying, just veggies. Sit at the bar as Ayla is a pro and she ensure you'll appreciate your meal and experience

Since the first day I stepped into the establishment in 2014, Table 34 has become a "home away from home" for me - something I do not say lightly. Chef Wes and the kitchen staff are amazing. I've been introduced to cuisine that has changed my palette and the way I eat.

The food is only part of the appeal for me. The ambiance of the restaurant itself - and more notably the warmth of the staff - is what helps make this establishment my "home away from home". Seriously, there are days when I have leftovers at the office but I decide to get away to Table 34 for lunch instead because I want to see the people as well as eat the food. I have found my "Cheers" - you know, the place "where everybody knows your name" (remember that theme song?).

Laurie is ever-amazing and the pinnacle of organization, genuine concern, and service delivery. She definitely runs a tight ship. I've dined there for lunch on days when the restaurant has been slammed, and Laurie definitely keeps the place moving. She has a very strong work ethic.

I enjoy my quick chats with Juan. Conversing with him is often a highlight of my day. I always feel well-taken care of by him. He's definitely a great guy! And I always look forward to seeing him! I cannot imagine this place without him.

Olivia is attentive, as well, and I think she knows my habits sometimes better than I do. On many occasions, having noticed if I've stopped eating for a certain amount of time while texting (bad habit, I know), Olivia has walked over to ask if I was finished with my food and needed a box. Usually, I'd say no, but literally seconds later I was full and  requesting a to-go box. Sometimes I'd smile and say to her, "I should've listened to you." (She's great!)

And then there's Elena, with whom I always feel I'm in good hands. She definitely checks up on me to make sure everything is good. And if I order something but forget to add some of my specialized detail, Elena will remember those details from the previous time and will ask me about them before putting in my order.

Then there's Tino - someone with whom I can rattle off an order at a rapid pace (no matter what it is) and he seems to usually remember it writing anything down or without missing a detail. I find this remarkable, as things in the restaurant can get quite busy and the staff serves many customers throughout the week. Tino also encourages me regarding my health and wellness goals.

Victor has a great sense of humor. Anybody can "try" to be funny, but Victor has great "comedic timing", as well as a great attitude in general. He definitely adds levity to my day. And on days when Victor isn't my server, it isn't uncommon for him to ask if I need a refill on water or need to box up my food as he walks by on those lighter days. Victor's philosophy is to respond to a need when you see it. I love that about him. David has done the same thing - as recently as last week, in fact.

If I need something, David's right there. If I have questions for Chef Wes before ordering or need to follow up on something, David's on it. I also enjoy chatting with him about weekend plans and hearing what he might have going on. And if I'm not feeling well or am distracted, David can tell without me saying a word. He always shows genuine concern for how I'm feeling.

And then there's Wilmer. Wilmer is the food runner during most days and occasionally works evenings. Having once worked in a restaurant myself, I can tell you his job is not simple. It requires a lot of coordination and staying on top of things behind the scenes. As the guests pour into the restaurant, I've often observed Wilmer taking note of who has been seated, who has food, who still have menus on their tables and yet to order, etc., all while delivering food to the next guest, without missing a step. Though busy, he's asked guests if they need anything else after he's delivered their meals. He's often taking care of the guests' additional needs or communicating those needs with the guests' servers - and he's done this while the place has been extremely busy. Watching him move through the restaurant at a steady pace and with a lot of endurance, I admire his tenacity.

I must give special shout-outs to Janina and Adrienne, whom I don't see regularly because of their shifts. Adrienne was one of the first servers I met when I started visiting Table 34 regularly, and she continues to be awesome every time I see her. And Janina is the epitome of class and care. She's what great guest service is all about!

The entire staff at Table 34 is beautiful inside and out, and that beauty extends to their service, as well as to the food. I'm so glad I know of this place. Of all the establishments I've visited in Vegas - restaurant or otherwise - Table 34 holds a special place in my heart. In subtle ways, my experiences there have helped shape the person I have become today.

5 stars service from John Kerry's double.  He care and he's a pro.   Few dishes were very good.  Others ordinary.  At the premium price, not worth it in my opinion unless in the area on the corporate Amex or to grab a quick bite with a friend.  Decor relaxing.  3.5 stars would be more fair.
Yum - everything was sooooooo good!  Large portions, delicious, fresh food, a keeper!

Very nice!   Classy and upscale but not too up tight!  The pork I had was a generous portion cooked and seasoned perfectly.   I was able to share my wife's linguini and the home made pasta was awesome!   Dinner for two came in at $65 without cocktails so it ain't cheap but worth every penny!   We'll be back!

A friend and I had dinner at Table 34 on Saturday night. I ordered beef tenderloin, and my friend ordered the roasted chicken. We both had the same reaction: the food was good but not memorable.  There were no sauces on either dish which left everything a little dry.

Our waiter was wonderful, and we always enjoy talking with the owner.  It's a lovely place but the chef needs to consider adding a saucy vegetable or component to every dish.

Tonight we attended our Company Christmas dinner, my first time to Table 34.  Delicious does not begin to describe the meal all of us had!  From the appetizer to the dessert it was one of the best meals I have ever had in Las Vegas.  We live on the northwest side of the valley and would make the drive again to enjoy the dining experience.  Thank you to our company for hosting but also thank you to the restaurant management and staff for making it memorable!

Last night, Frank and I dined at Table 34. I've heard good things and Restaurant Week was the perfect excuse. I made a reservation last week, but they didn't have it. Fortunately, they had seating available and we were seated right away. We both chose the Restaurant Week menu; three courses for $40.13.
 
We started with Duck Confit Quesadilla with Spicy-Blackberry Syrah Coulis, this was delicious and it came with a small salad and scrumptious grapes. I'd return for this alone (but everything was really good)! It bursts with flavor. 

Entrees were brought over a short bit later, I had Butternut Squash Ravioli with Sage-Brown Butter and Toasted Walnuts and Frank had the Grilled Pork Chop with Chipotle Potato Puree, Mixed Veggies and Hard Cider Glaze. Both were well executed and very good, but Frank chose the better dish. The chipotle mashed were hearty and smokey. And the chop was tender, juicy, and had a nice char.

And then for dessert, Frank chose the Chocolate-Peanut Butter Pie with Honeycomb Clusters and Lemon Cheesecake with Candied Lemon Zest. The peanuts with the honeycomb reminded me of Crunch-N-Munch, the chocolate peanut butter pie was creamy and decadent. The cheesecake tasted like summer, it was light and comforting with a nice blend of sweet and tart. 

Service was quick and friendly. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere; even when full it wasn't too noisy. Table 34 is a real gem. It was nice to see them openly promote Restaurant Week. All too often restaurants hide the specials and they're only offered when asked.

This is an excellent upscale menu with off strip pricing and exceptional quality! 

We have been coming to this neighborhood favorite for years now and it never disappoints. Great wait staff and fantastic chef come together to make this dining experience superb. 

Try the ribs if they are on special and if you are lucky enough to be there when they are serving lobster Mac and cheese it's worth the indulgence!!!

This is the most wonderful elevated home cooked meal ever!!
I think we have enjoyed almost everything on the entire menu and can't wait to go back for more!
Lunch is fantastic and dinners are incredible!!!

Thank you Table 34

The food and service is amazing. The owner, Lori, is very pleasant. I visit during lunch time, mostly business lunches. Their fish and chips on Fridays are amazing. This week I was on the diet so I asked them to grill the fish rather than fry it, and they were very accommodating.
One of the best places to eat in Las Vegas! The atmoshphere, food, and service is top notch! Great for a special occasion or just a weeknight dinner out! Can't say enough good about this place!

I ordered the new York steak,  and I've definitely have had better.  Wasnt cooked right, not tender enough. It was well done, I had asked for medium.  
Service was okay,  I enjoy interacting with the servers, but in this case there wasn't much. The owner however, was very welcoming.  That's a plus.

A go to for a good dinner.  We have been there twice and both times were awesome.  The service was always prompt and courteous.  I have made recommendations to people I know, and have always been thanked after the fact by those who have eaten there.

Table 34 was great for Happy hour! I went on a Saturday between 5-6pm. I ordered duck carnitas, oyster rockerfeller, and the Kobe beef sliders...everything was tasty. I sat at the bar and really enjoyed our bartender..I think her name is Aliena. The pumpkin spice pie was also scrumptious. I will definitely come back for future happy hours!

I've never had a bad meal here. They have perfected the service back of house and front of house. It's high level and consistent. They regular menus items are great and they offer specials to provide something different if you don't want one of the go-to's. Last time I had the Bison Burger - which was one of the specials. It was perfect. Really not much more to say about it.

The food was amazingly delicious!! The servers made this "a night to remember!" Great service overall!! Thank you for a pleasant 5 star meal, chef and Janina! You are the best!! Bravo on the elaboration!! Gracias!

We saw this restaurant on Rachael Ray's Vacations and thought we'd try it the next time we were in Las Vegas.  We are glad we did.  The restaurant is located in a strip shopping center; so, free parking is plentiful.  The decor/ambiance is very nice and the wait staff is professional and attentive.  And, best of all, the food is excellent.  We had a hard time choosing what to eat; because, each selection sounded so good.  I chose the meat loaf (I love meat loaf) and my wife had the salmon.  Both choices were very, very good.  

The wine list is little pricey.  We selected a 2009 Malbec from Argentina for $38 (one of the cheaper selections) and were very pleased.    

We highly recommend Table 34 and will definately go back.

Cool atmosphere and great design here.
A little on the pricey side but very good drinks and great food.
I highly recommend this place.

3 stars only because food was on point as always however customer service was lacking. we entered the restaurant and the host's back was facing the door. he had no idea we were there until a server poked her head around the corner and told him. it was 55 degrees out, tell me you didn't feel the cold air on your back? once seated it took somewhere between 7-10 min for our server to acknowledge our table and offered us water. we were ready to order both beverages and our food but he walked away before either one of us could say anything. upon his return he informed us of the specials (as his eyes were wandering elsewhere), but he spoke so quickly that it was hard for us to understand him.  he walked away and tended to a table of 4 which seem to captivate his attention for most of the night. by now we had been in the restaurant for 20 minutes, both of us hungry and our order had yet to be placed. when our server finally came around to take our order I barely got out the appetizer order and he interuppted me and asked if we wanted him to get our drinks on the bar! frustration at this point was high. when our food finally arrived I was disappointed to find something on my dish that wasnt described in the special. luckily I did not have an allergy to it and I am 100% positive he did not say it when telling us the specials. I was so upset at this point I didn't send the food back and merely pushed the unwanted part of my food to the side of the plate. it seemed like there was no sense of natural friendliness and urgency except for when it was time for the bill to be brought to the table. I am completely surprised that this type of service is allowable here. I've dined many times before and received exceptional customer service.

Yes they do take reservations. but what if you are trying to make a reservation when they are closed? No live person answers the phone. I cant wait to hear back from somebody. This day and age, everything is done electronically because we all operate more efficiently that way. This place needs to get some kind of online reservations.

Good food, decent service, huge plates so my boyfriend and I always split something and it's more than enough. Wine list is meh, and we are always the youngest diners in there (only ever dined there for dinner) -- definitely a (way) older crowd... Not a cool "scene" at all, just convenient for us as it's so close to our house, and for a healthy yummy dinner it works!

Met a friend for lunch, this was my first time here. I used to work in this area but never had the chance to stop in. I am glad I finally got the chance. 
I like the decor. It is much bigger from what I imagined. We were seated right away. Our server was great. There when we needed her, not pesky.
I had the steak salad, I am not much of a salad person, however this was fantastic. The steak was so tender, I did not even need a steak knife. Perfectly cooked and seasoned. The dressing was a little sweet, not overwhelming. The salad was perfectly dressed. It came with roasted potatoes, they were a little under seasoned. It had tossed walnuts added a nice crunch factor. I would have this dish again. My friend had the steak sandwich she said it was great. Hers came with a side of pasta salad which was also good. 
Yes it is pricey, but you get what you pay for, and to have great food and service, then to me it is worth it.
Eat here every time we are in town. Decent food, highly priced. The menu is getting very boring. From year to year it has hardly changed. Won't be going back.

Come early as this place fills up quick. I came for lunch and got the White Albacore Tuna Melt, bit put it on Sourdough and added Avocado (Really Tasty!!).  Went with the Fries for my side. They did not still have the Potato Chips or Tater Tots as a side. I'll be back, there were several other items I'd like to try!!

I don't have time to Yelp, but this is way over due... In this city where restaurants come and go there is one that never ever disappointed me... Table 34.

The service is always good so our the meal, I have been going there for over 10 years and will keep going!
The arugola salad with goat cheese, apples and walnuts in a citrus dressing was delicious. 
I wanted pizza and decided to try the pizza with bacon, gouda cheese, spinach and mushroom... LOVED!

To full for dessert. Another great meal at Table 34. Prices are right, service is good, food is delicious and location is easy to get to.

Wonderful fresh food, great for a lunch or dinner date or for a business meeting. Affordable prices and large portions. By the glass wine menu is great too. Loved the beet salad and the steak salad, soups are wonderful too -had the tomato tarragon delicious. Lemon cheesecake recipe as very good and loved the lemon curd and Fresh fruit that came with it

Table 34 is always on our list of places to eat in Las Vegas. Classy service and consistency in food taste and appearance. 
I had a turkey sandwich with fruit and iced tea. Everything was fresh, including the fruit which is always ripe and ready to eat 
The help is always on the ball filling water and tea glasses. Never an empty glass. 

Don't forget to grab a cookie on the way out.
Really like this place.  Good food and the staff is very friendly.  The wait is the only reason for a drop in a star.  Otherwise have at it.
The manager is very personable and friendly, and the food is great.  My favorite is the scallop and artichoke salad.

I've been a customer here for years. I am a friend and huge fan of the chef, Wes Kendrick. Wes is something of a food prodigy. He does everything extremely well from soups to desserts. He is passionate about what he does and it shows. First, the soups... you never know what they are going to be, but they are all made fresh daily and they are always amazing. If you're looking for the Vegas equivelent of the "Soup Nazi", it is to be found here in a bowl next to the famed "sage biscuit" which can only be described as amazing. Want a bison burger or filet? Venison? This is one of the few wild game fine dining establishments I know of, and it doesn't disappoint! Some favorites would include the pastrami sandwich at lunch (WOW!), the pot roast at dinner (WOW), and while it's hard for me to believe... the baby back ribs at dinner! Since so many places specialize in baby back ribs, it is unfathomable to me that a place that has them as an item on their menu dusts the competition. These are the best I've ever had in any city, period. The waitstaff is knowledgable both in the items, specials, and the preparation. One standout... Ken is an EXCEPTIONAL server and his suggestions are ALWAYS on the mark. Along with Mundo, this is one of the best kept local's secrets in Las Vegas. I've brought friends here from out of town and when they come back, they always ask to visit again.

The dinner was the best I've ever had.
For the same reasons Iove great sushi but dislike mediocre sushi, i loved my meal. 

1: bartender made a mean, flavorful lemon drop martini. 
2: my beet salad was incredibly well balanced. 
Between the red/yellow beets, candied walnuts , and other accoutrements drizzled in the salad , each bite , in the same mouthful , had ever changing elements. Thank you chef. 
3: lamb. I asked for medium rare. While one medallion was mostly rare/cold, not even warm in the middle. The done ness of the others was perfect. 
Again. The light crust of pepper flavored rub added a tang that came and went with each bite. I'd order it again. 
4: salmon. Commercial fishing was an occupation of mine, still live in Alaska and have never gotten over the wonderful flavor of fresh salmon. I've literally been up to my am pits in tons of salmon. 
Love it love it love it. 
And the chef did an outstanding job of cooking it for the spouse.  The salmon was the predominant flavor and it was neither over or under cooked. 
That's a real test in my book for a chef. 

So why only 4 Stars. 
The pumpkin pie. 

While others rave about it, and we were convinced to try it. 
We took a slice home , had a bite, and threw it out. 
Why:
For the same rationale we loved the meal , we hated the pie.  
I enjoy a bite of food, dessert, or meal, when the item advertised is the main  flavor. 
The delicate flavor of the pumpkin pie was so overwhelmed my other flavors , spices, it might have well have been orange colored, flavored, tofu. 

It's a harsh critique of pie..
I know. 

If you want pumpkin pie I taste like pumpkin ,
Don't get the pumpkin pie. 
If you want your pumpkin pie to taste like fancy spiced crust and a sliced purée... get it. 

I expected a more refined flavor of dessert after the outstanding meal. 

I'll come again for sure. 
Loved the food. 
( I'll pass on the pie )

Had a very nice evening. Food was very affordable, menu inventive with specials like Venison meatballs and fried frogs legs. Quite entertaining. Scallops were also really good. Sauce was a bit overpowering but tasteful.

The sauteed golden trout was excellent, some of the best seafood that I've ever had. The rice pilaf and mixed vegetables were also very good. The service was outstanding. We arrived before dinner opening but they seated us anyway and still provided prompt and quick service (which we needed because we had a flight to catch). Yelp has this as $$, I would put it as $$$.

I've been to Table 34 more times than I care to admit however it was one of my favorite go to places when traveling on business mainly out of convenience.  Although I've never eaten dinner here, I can tell you that the lunches are top notch.

I'm a little embarrassed to admit but one of my lunch staples here was their mac-n-cheese.  Why on earth would grown man be ordering that??  Because colleagues spoke highly about it and I just had to give it a try.  Glad I did because I ended up ordering this dish more times than not.  This isn't your boxed mac-n-cheese.  No, this is a multi cheese dish that is ultimately covered in more cheese / bread crumbs and broiled to perfection.

If you don't want to eat as an 8 year old, which I cannot blame you, other good bets are their pizzas.   If you're a fan of mushrooms, I'd recommend their wild mushroom  pizza.

Each time I've Ben here, I've never had any issues with the service as  they have always been extremely attentive and responsive to my requests.  The staff is not flat as other restaurants and always willing to jar around some friendly banter. 

The only downside to Table 34 is its location.  For first timers, it can be a little difficult to find.  Perhaps that's a good thing for me?

I was invited to lunch by a friend. I've always wondered what it was like every time I drove by this place. I was pleasantly surprised. It was quaint, kind of bistro style and metro. It's very clean and upscale but don't let that scare you as the prices were decent. I had a bison burger that was uber delicious and savory for under $9. Ask your server for specials of the day. Great place. I will be revisiting frequently.

Table 34 delivers great service, food and ambiance!

We stopped in to try this hidden gem off of Warm Springs.  You can't see it from the road but it sits behind Starbucks.  There is plenty of parking for their dining patrons. The dining area is nicely decorated to create an enjoyable experience.  

We were there early enough to partake in their happy hour at the bar.  There are also a few tables near the bar area where you can take advantage of the special deals.  We started off with their House prepared chips with truffle aioli.  Warning~  Their aioli is very addictive!  I wanted to spread it on everything.  They also give you a generous amount of their chips!

My husband tried the Cider Glazed Pork Ribs w/Cajun Fries.  These literally fell off the bone.  Very tender with a nice glaze.  My Kobe beef sliders were awesome.   They came with caramelized onions, swiss and thousand island.  Each bite just melted in your mouth.  The sweet potato tots that I ordered with the sliders complimented each other wonderfully!  Again, a generous amount of the sweet potato tots are provided from the HH menu.  

We had amazing service from Adrienne at the bar.  She was funny, entertaining and attentive.  You could tell some of her regulars loved to stop in just to see her.  She is definitely an asset.

We certainly enjoyed our happy hour experience here.  I hope to be back to try their full menu!

Enjoyed the final evening of Restaurant Week at Table 34.  They offered numerous selections for each course, more than many other restaurants, so it was fun that the four of us were able to sample from a variety of offerings.

We started at the bar, waiting for our dinner partners.  A very pleasant, older woman made me a savory dirty martini and suggested a lovely chardonnay for my husband.

Our first entree:  citrus & garlic green lip mussels served with a fresh ocean salad; duck confit quesadilla with a drizzle of a blackberry syrah coulis; heirloom tomatoes & mozzarella with a balsamic reduction, and chilled beets with goat cheese, candied walnuts and raspberry vinaigrette.  Very nice servings and beautiful presentations!  The mussels were awesome, the duck confit quesadilla was so savory, the chilled beets were incredibly refreshing, and heirloom tomatoes are always so flavorful.

2nd Course:  All four of us went for the same two dishes!  Seared salmon with a cauliflower puree and lemon-dill butter, and the grilled pork chop with the chipotle potato puree, asparagus and a cider glaze.  The cider glaze was a wonderful, slightly sweet compliment to the grilled pork chops (nice grill marks, by the way), and the chipotle potato puree was a earthy, slightly sweet surprise.  And then there was the salmon.  Wow!  Perfectly cooked & incredibly tender without being slimy and cauliflower was so light yet didn't lose that smoky, earthy cauliflower flavor.  Wonderful!

3rd Couse:  Since there were four dessert offerings and four of us, well it was obvious.  We were all dubious of the chocolate, peanut butter pie but what a surprise!  True to its flavors but without overwhelming or anything in-your-face.  I personally loved the refreshingly light lemon cheesecake.  It had this candied lemon zest on top that was just incredible.  After trying McConnell's Creme Di Leche And Churro ice cream served with a caramel sauce and generous, crunchy, churro-like cookie/cracker, my husband is determined to buy McConnell's ice cream.  Are you a chocolate lover?  The flourless chocolate cake is decadent and served with a raspbberry coulis.  It's sinful and rich!

Thank you, Table 34 for a wonderful meal!

This is a great hidden gem in Vegas! My favorite thing on the menu would be either the scallop salad or the Scottish salmon. They use seasonal ingredients of high quality. I went there for lunch today and the health inspector was also there... they weren't even worried! Love that they know they are doing the right thing!
Brought my friend for his first time.....we both absolutely love this place!   Food-exquisite, service impeccable, atmosphere upscale comfortable.

Always have a great experience at Table 34. Delicious, flavorful salads and professional staff make it my favorite lunch location when nearby. Great location, robust soups (creamy tomato was the best yesterday!) and attentive staff. Lovely!

I had never heard of this place until today. We had one of our bosses come in town for a meeting and they decided to take us to lunch. Table 34 is located close to work so the owner decided to take us there. I must say it was not very visible if you weren't looking for it but it is located in the same parking lot as Starbucks and US Bank. The atmosphere is very nice and decorative, there is an open kitchen and the wait staff is amazing. I ordered the BBQ chipotle wrap with fries and it was amazing and the portion size is nice too. One other person had the salad that was on special (can't remember the name) and had no complaints. The two guys with us ordered a steak sandwich and sweet potato fries. They did say the steak was a little tough and should have been sliced thinner but otherwise it was delicious. They provide an amazing bread and butter before your meal and all the breads are homemade. This is a home owned business and there are no franchises. The pricing is probably a little more than you would plan to spend on a wrap or sandwich and fries but keep in mind it is all homemade. I will definitely make another trip one of these days. Enjoy! :)

I've been coming to Table 34 on a semi/occasional basis for probably about 10 years now. My recent trip was fabulous as usual. Table 34 is the place we can always count on for well done cocktails and great food. Service has always been exceptional and price is fair for the quality of the meals. Can't recommend enough!

Waitress was great. Very knowledgeable, never had to ask for refills, or wait for our plates to be cleared.

Food was ok, nothing to write home about.... overpriced.

I just had lunch at Table 34 with a coworker. It was very sophisticated without being stuffy. The food was impeccable for the price. Not cheap, but what food worthwhile is? It didn't break the bank, the prices remind you of the delights to come. I got there as they opened at 11am and the place was empty. The service was great because of that, so I recommend getting there before 12 noon as well. I had the corkscrew pasta with boar meatballs. It was very nice for $14's.

Today around noon was my first visit to Table 34. I have lived in Las Vegas for eleven years and have driven past this location numerous times wondering what it could be. I finally decided today to check it out. 

Table 34 has a wonderful appearance with large mirrors to the left which almost make the dining room look twice the size. the tables, linen, and flatware were clean and I was greeted immediately. I was seated near a window and close to the bar. my server was polite and knowledgeable regarding the menu.

 I decided on the chef special thanks which was fish and chips. This is where I experienced failure. Table 34 gives the impression of an upscale diner, but the food I received was of quality you can find at Denny's for much less. Fish batter tasted of nothing, the fries were under seasoned, and the coleslaw was something you could buy from a bag at the local grocery store. just cabbage, carrot, and mayonnaise.

Table 34 is the most amazing restaurant in Vegas!   Laurie and Wes hosted our wedding celebration on their patio!   We had an intimate party of 16 people.   The weather was perfect!  Food was perfect!  Service - Perfect!
We met with Laurie about a month prior to the event.    She was spot on with her suggestions of a course of passed appetizers and a cheese and fruit table.   We had an open bar for the entire event.  Then suggested the "ceremony" to be followed by a champagne toast by the best man and best woman!   The champagne Schramsberg Mirabelelle Brut Rose was so awesome.    Dinner followed with a choice of 4 different main courses, including one for both of us (vegan).   After dinner, the wedding cake.   Laurie made recommendations for the Florist (again, perfect).   
The evening came off without a hitch!  Laurie choreographed the entire event!   Wes' food was once again the best we ever had.   We had lived in Vegas in the early 2000's and enjoyed his food at least once a week.    
So, for anyone looking for a venue for a small intimate dinner, wedding reception for just a few, or just amazing food, give Table 34 a definite try.   You won't be sorry.    Oh, and by the way, ours was the first Gay Wedding Reception at Table 34!    Let's keep the energy flowing and hope you might be the next!

Ken and Vince.

Came here once years ago, but didn't remember the experience so I came back again as part of a work group lunch.   Ordered the personal pizza and I was impressed with the size and quality of the pizza.  It's a thin crust style pizza, but still packs a lot of taste and was large enough for me to take about half to go although I am generally considered a relatively light eater.  Price is a little high, but not too bad.  Service was pretty good and the food arrived in good amount of time.

Table 34 has always been one of my favorite places for lunch.  They have always had extremely good waiters and waitresses that would provide a 5 star experience.  I don't know what has happened by that great wait staff is no more. The wait staff seems to be 100% hispanic that talk amongst themselves in spanish and look and laugh at the guests, they don't speak very good english and do not have the skill set of the prior wait staff.  I ate there yesterday and when they delivered the food they just shoved it in front of me pushing my soup bowl aside with my main dish.  Almost in an angry way.  I had to keep asking the waiter what he was saying as i did not understand him.  So sad as i won't be going back here unless someone else takes me.  I don't support operational tactics like this.  Bring back the experienced what staff and only hire people who can actually speak english.

This review is only for lunch. I've been here twice and thoroughly enjoyed both experiences. The staff is very knowledgable and professional. What I really respect is the chef and his passion and creativity. He keeps his menu seasonal and inventive, but at the same time very approachable and clean. 
On one trip we had an excellent assortment of warm bread, my second visit we were offered one type of cold slightly stale bread. Other than that I have no other complaints.
I can't wait to come back for dinner.
Very nice different menu, a lot of specials and good quality food in small intimate setting, they make you feeling like family!

I cannot say anything negative about this place because food and customer service are exceptional. When I think quality food, I think of this place. There isn't a thing on the menu that isn't amazing. Everything is so good. They just use quality food and ingredients, and it's evident in appearance and taste. Ambiance is great too. Definitely a lunch spot. But it also looks busy during dinner time when I get off of work. The ambiance is great indoor n out. Servers are attentive and quick. If you love the taste and feel of quality, eat at Table 34. If you don't know what quality tastes n feels like, eat at Table 34. For you meat eaters, the pork chop is great. All of their salads are top notch! Any of their daily soup offerings are amazing too.

Lovely evening for an anniversary celebration at Table 34 tonight! Chef Wes came out to greet us, and the service was impeccable.  The nightly specials were delivered like an elegant poem, and the food was divine.  Shishito peppers and potato garlic soup to begin.  I think I will pass on the peppers next time, I just think there are tastier options to choose from.  Cioppino for my husband, and filet for myself.  Both  highly recommended.  Ended the night with a delicious chocolate peanut butter dessert with peanuts and honeycomb on top... on the house in honor of our 7 years together.  We will definitely return and bring friends next time! The only thing I would like to see is a cocktail menu.

Had out of town visitors who look for best kept secrets off the strip-so we tried Table 34.What an exceptional dinner! The food was very fresh, beautifully presented, and wonderful flavors. The pricing seems firm for the suburbs, however the quality is exceptional and the portions are large so actually is better than the ala carte pricing so common on the strip. I can't recall a more polite and attentive server and the pleasant bistro feel made for a great way to catch up with friends. Grilled salmon and asparagus were gorgeous and tasty, a vegan diner was accommodated deliciously, and the chocolate salted caramel ice cream and cream Brule were very good. I look forward to returning often.
The quality of the food and the very polite and attentive service was phenomenal. The price is so good for the quality and service you get! Loved it here!

Took my wife here for her birthday dinner last night. All I can say it was incredible,not just a meal but an experience.
We had the quail and Maine scallops for the apps and we both had the Bison filet Mignon,it was seared and cooked perfectly. Finished it off with the peach cobbler and a fantastic Italian coffee,better than any coffee you would get next door at Starbucks. I highly recommend this place and I see people commenting on the prices,you get what you pay for certainly applies here and I'm not complaining!
Very classy lunch spot. This place would be better only if it was bigger and had a little bit more elbow room. It's a tight fit but the food is second to none!  Highly recommended

Came here for our anniversary on 8/6/15. We were visiting from Los Angeles for a few days and I was lucky enough to find this restaurant through yelp. 

The decor is classy and modern. 
The service is impeccable.
The food was delicious. 
We both left full and happy.

We will definitely dine here again when we come back to Las Vegas.

Btw...i had the ribs and he had the steak.

Went in for happy hour on a Thursday night @ 5:30. Nice atmosphere, much older crowd (6 people in the whole place, all over 50) music was all wrong, walked in & bar tender, was eating tater tots with a patron. What an impression! Artichoke with moxed greens was fantastic! Pizza don't bother, cheese plate so-so & sweet potato tots (hard to mess up, but mustard dipping sauce no good. The lemon aioli that was served with the artichoke should also be with the tots. Kinda bummed, I really wanted to like he place!

Table 34 has delicious food and reasonable prices considering the quality.  This review however is specifically for my waitress Jamina M.  She was the best-- knew the menu inside and out, was extremely attentive, made awesome recommendations, and overall, loves her job.  I felt at home in this restaurant, and it was because of Jamina.  Thank you!

Amazing restaurant! Outstanding food, exceptional service and classy atmosphere.  My wife and I  were visiting from Savannah, Georgia. Found them on Yelp.  Lori warmly greeted us at the front door.  Served by Victor and a young lady who kept our water glasses filled, making at least a half dozen trips to the table.  Ordered the pork chops.  Apple glazed or marinated chops were the best I have had anywhere. My wife had scallops which were excellent!  The experience was so good we returned the next night for an equalling outstanding experience.  On our second visit, Lori treated us to a dessert.  Very nice touch.  By the end of the meal we felt like we had new friends. Highly recommended restaurant! Next time we are in Vegas we will stop here again.

Oh my goodness this was the best meal I had in Vegas. This establishment was in a quant little shopping center. The ambience was nice. Dressy casual was the dress code, although folks were there in shorts. The steak was cooked to perfection and so flavorful. The Scallops were succulent and paired with spinach and a  cauliflower mash. The food presentations was beautiful. The wait service was prompt and courteous. The wait for our food was a just a little longer than anticipated but when the food came it was so worth the wait. For desert we had a succulent Chocolate Mouse Tiramisu to die for. The portions were large of everything. Wine selection was great too. Great place to dine for sure.

Had a great meal here. Their ribs are fantastic. A sweet yet savory sauce to top it off. Only thing was that my fries were really over salted or over seasoned. Great atmosphere. Kinda far from the strip.

This gem of a fine dining experience (with a casual dress code) sits deceptively tucked next to a Subway/Winchell's in an office park. "I think it may be closed," said Mike, as we parked the car and took in the dark windows. We realized someone was inside but, taking in this modest exterior and the lone man at the door, we already feared the awkwardness of leaving if we didn't like the look of the menu. 

The menu is described as seasonal, and unfortunately it isn't officially available online, but on this night it was very similar to what websites have posted. We decided to stay.

And as we stepped behind the wall, we could only laugh at ourselves from 60 seconds before. Although the atmosphere was pleasant and calm, any later on this Saturday evening and we might've needed reservations. 

It was easy for this vegetarian and her picky husband to find interesting items to eat. (Although I wish a meatless pasta option had been available on this occasion.) Our server had such a welcoming demeanor that I didn't mind listening to him describe the specials (and I do mean describe). He lovingly outlined three appetizers, two salads, and three main dishes. (And, later, three desserts, but desserts deserve their own paragraph.)

We started with one of the special appetizers, shishito peppers and pepper aioli. I still don't know how I feel about sauteed shishitos, but they were fun to try. The amount of bitterness varied quite a bit from pepper to pepper, but they were so expertly prepared that the bitterness was possibly a feature.

The bread basket (two walnut slices, two aromatic white) looked like its contents might be a bit dry or tough, but neither was the case. The bread is subtly tasty, but I strongly recommend not filling up on it as there is so much else to try. (So don't be a doof like me and agree to a refill.)

Mike and I both ordered salads: his a simple mixed greens affair, mine arugula with candied walnuts, pears, goat cheese, and citrus vinaigrette. The dressing was bright and pleasing (I sound like Alex Guarnaschelli), and the salad was delicious overall, although I didn't quite taste any special treatment of the walnuts. One thing I appreciates is that the (again, excellent) servers timed everything well, so we really got to enjoy our salads. Lately, everywhere we go, we seem to be a third of the way through the salad when suddenly the main course shows up. Is this a new thing? If so, Table 34 has successfully dodged this trend.

For our main dishes, Mike got the special baby back ribs with apple-cucumber slaw, Cajun fries, and a slice of watermelon. I chose the wild mushroom pizza. My other vegetarian options were a different pizza (margherita style) or a vegetable and eggplant stack with two cheeses. 

Mmmm. Tangy. Herby. Cheesy. Scented. Mmmmm. Every bite was a winner. (I was too blissed to listen to my husband exclaim wonder at how the meat just fell off his ribs.) The pizza style is somewhat Napolitan, a short, puffy edge with a thin base. However, no part of it was soggy, which is too often my complaint with thin pizzas. Even Settebello, a quality establishment, disappoints me with their wet middles. This pizza had all of that same taste of quality ingredients while not requiring that I get out a spoon once an inch away from the outer crust.

That said, I did eat some of the cheesier parts of my pizza with a knife and fork, conscious of my surroundings. Patron dress was everything from button-down shirts and smart blouses to casual shorts and sandals, and I'd happily visit again in jeans, but the upscale vibe and atmosphere just naturally nudges you into not being a heathen. (And if it doesn't, hopefully you have a wife to nudge you into taking your elbows off the table. My husband will recognize the value of my nagging someday, I'm sure. Perhaps during the eulogy.)

I only ate two of the smaller pieces of pizza because I *had* to see what the chef would do for dessert. One of the assisting servers boxed my pizza (in a traditional pizza box, even), and we were presented with the dessert menus and the three specials.

Thank goodness for those specials because one of them was a tasting trio of three of the desserts: vanilla bean creme brulee with berries, flourless chocolate cake with raspberry coulis, and lime tart with pecan crust and lemon curd. The clear choice!

The waiter brought a spoon and a fork for each of us, in case we wanted to share. (Mike swore that he was too full.) And, not to be fixated on cutlery, but the dessert spoons were perfect! Long handles, small bowls - okay, maybe this is my lonely fetish, but expect a photo to be uploaded shortly.

Each item was outstanding. I can't even pick a favourite. None were unusually fancy, but again, you could taste the sound ingredients and skillful preparation. Suffice to say that my "too full" husband and I were soon engaged in a spoon fight to claim territory on the plate.

I wonder what's on the lunch menu...

While the food is impeccable I think we were placed in the front corner away from everyone during lunchtime because my sister and I came in with a 4 and 1 year old. I get it, they may have thought the kids would be loud or obnoxious for other patrons. However our kids are good and quiet and felt it was a bit discriminatory.

I can't u deed tans how this restaurant only has 4 stars.  We have eaten here a dozen times and every single meal has been outstanding.  The service is impeccable, quiet and efficient. The food always excellent. We did the restaurant week menu of turkey tacos - delicious and moist, Scottish salmon perfectly cooked - moist and crispy and a lime pie desert.  $40. Amazing value and outstanding quality.

Tried this restaurant last night and it was so good.  The food they offer is a variety.  Fish, pasta, ribs.  Great flavors. Their specials were awesome. Great wine choices too!  
Will definitely go again.

What a great restaurant, Victor our server was awesome. The food was fantastic, I had the fresh pasta and lobster and my husband the Halibut. We were told about this restaurant by locals and were not disappointed will be back in Vegas in December and will bring our friends.

After reading the reviews of this restaurant, I was particularly disgusted with my experience because I expected much more. I chose this restaurant to take my friend for a birthday dinner and we both left feeling anything but joyous. We arrived and were greeted by a hateful man that tried to shame us for not having a reservation... well excuse me, I didn't think a restaurant off the strip would have a line out the door at 5:30... and it didn't, so what was the big deal? Don't you want new patrons to come to your restaurant? Should have left then. 

We were set at a table and the waitress came over at first friendly (named Eleana) but soon had a attitude issue where she would then go over to another server/table cleaner and stand there and glare at us. Giving her the benefit of doubt and assuming maybe she just has resting b-face, I said thank you when she brought water or our food.  But really? This is a small place, if you want to glare at the customers, at least try to hide it and go to the kitchen... we tried the restaurant menu to get an array of the selection of food offered: duck tacos, apple cider shrimp with coleslaw, lobster Mac and cheese, pork chop with cider glaze, creme brûlée, and lemon cheesecake. Weirdly when both my friend and I were sitting waiting on the dessert to come, we were both over come with sickness, and even hours after this meal, are both sick. I generously give this place 2 stars for the dessert, but I won't be returning and for sure won't be recommending this establishment.

This is a fantastic restaurant.  I have nothing negative to say.  I have been going here for about 3 years and I have never been disappointed.  The menu doesn't change very often.  They do have amazing specials that you should definitely try. The service is exceptional.  (try the white chocolate bread)

This is a hidden but delicious little gem in Vegas. Right next to my work, its a great option for lunch. I have never been for dinner because I live clear on the other side of town - but I am not surprised that it too has excellent Yelp reviews! During my regular hours the restaurant is bright and pretty open - although they do fit a lot of people into such a smallish place.

I particularly enjoy the arugula salad. With goat cheese, apples, candied walnuts, and citrus vinaigrette is it is so refreshing. By paying a little bit extra you can add grilled chicken and make it filling. It really is the perfect salad to me. Service is always on point too, I get the full expensive dinner service feel even when I just stop in for a quick bite.

Absolutely awesome experience for a date night with my wife at Table 34. We had the grilled scallops appetizer with the Dijon bbq. The scallops were tender and soft with a perfect grill for a slight crisp exterior. The Dijon bbq was subtle and paired well with the sweetness of the scallops. My wife had the Manhattan seafood soup which was obviously very fresh and had great flavor without an overwhelming tomato flavor that is often found in Manhattan style chowders. I had the arugula salad with herb goat cheese candied walnuts, apples, and grapes in a lemon vinaigrette. Very refreshing. My wife ordered the Ny Strip for her entree and it was expertly cooked topped with melted blue cheese crumbles. It was served with mixed vegetables(super fresh and clearly made to order and not over cooked) and horseradish mashed potatoes which were so good that we ordered two more sides to bring home. For my entree I ordered the rack of lamb, also cooked perfectly, had a peppercorn brandy sauce with complimented the flavor of the lamb amazingly. 

Jannina was incredible. She was super professional and made sure every stage of the meal was timed appropriately. She even gave a little back story of the restaurant. We told her how happy we were with everything and she also informed us of the different hours throughout the week(they are closed for dinner on Sunday and Monday, which we probably wouldn't have known until we showed up and they were closed lol). 

Overall one of the best meals we've had in a long time. We will definitely be back. Thank you to everyone at Table 34.

My wife and i went for her first time last night to table 34 and we really enjoyed it.  This hidden gem is worth checking out.  It has been a while since I had been and we will be coming back more often.  We had and scallops and they were amazing.  The service as well as the restaurant its self was top notch.

What a great find and we didn't use Yelp this time!!!

We ordered:
Jalapeno potato soup 
Pizza
Ribs and cajun fries
Linguine

Everything was fresh and delicious.  The Jalapeno potato soup was especially tasty!  My son loved, loved it.  Portions were generous too.  I would recommend sitting inside if you are not accustom to LV weather.  Definitely worth a return trip next time we are in LV.

I am writing this review basing on my experience on 06-15-2016.

This is my fouth time eating at Table 34.

Ambience: Even Starbucks will have better ambience than Table 34.

Service: Waitress are not properly trained and their Customer service is not fitting to the reputation of the restaurant. Fake smiles, Spilling drinks, Missing Politeness While approaching guests, No intro to their menu specials, High order taking time.

Food: We ordered Oven Roasted Half Duckling and Herb Roasted Chicken. Apple-Sage Dressing is mostly burnt. The food is certainly not to die for. I strongly think their food is priced high for its quality. i dont think the chef put his heart and soul into the food he prepares. 

Professionalism: for the restaurant of this stature its minimum courtesy to speak in english while around clients, at one point i felt like i am in Roberto's or El Polo Loco. The guy at the front is flirting with one of the waitress pulling and pushing her infront of guests.

I have eaten at many reputable restaurants, table 34 falls at the bottom of that list. Food is not worth the money and Service is not upto the standards. Spend your hard earned money some place else.
This is a wonderful restaurant. The salmon is amazing. The service is excellent. I always try to have lunch here when I am in Las Vegas. I am sure it is a great place for dinner too.

Our family has dined here many times and celebrated birthday dinners along with casual dinners, and never had a bad experience. The comments from DreamerR on June 16 are just ridiculous. My father in law, is old Vegas and he knows every good chef and restaurant in this city and he will tell you Chef Wes is one of the best local chefs around.The service is impeccable. Jannina served us again and I would put her up against any top five star restaurant service in this town. 
The food prepared by Chef Wes is top quality and fresh. This is why long time locals dine here for a good reason. The baby back ribs have been their special off the menu for years and worth every bite. We brought in our own bottle of 08 Artesa Butala cab for a $20 corkage fee and paired it to the chef's marinara sauce and it was bon appetit !! Sauteed shrimp with angle hair pasta and chicken linguini, substituted with angel hair was perfect. Father in law had the rack of pork and couldn't finish the second chop. These entrees are enough to take home and finish eating them the next day.  
There are a lot of good reviews on other sites like TripAdvisor regarding Table 34. If there is ever a problem, they will fix it to make sure you are happy.

Went here for the first time and man am I annoyed I haven't been here sooner! We ordered a bottle of wine (first place in Vegas I've been to in a while that actually have a really good AFFORDABLE wine list). I ordered the lamb, my partner ordered the ribeye, and we had scallops as an appetizer. All of it was incredible. The crowd was definitely on the older side, which I guess is not surprising for the area. We were there on a weekend night and there were maybe 6 people under 40, most were 40-60. Service was excellent and attentive. Cannot wait to go back.

I hesitate to post this for fear millions of people will rush to Table 34 and pack the place! This is our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  We've eaten at Joes and Eiffel, Mona Mi, Mesa, Craft, Emerils, Del Monico, The Golden Steer to name a few, but for relaxing ambience and refreshing food dishes, delightful specials, amazing dishes like Bone in Filet, Barramundi Sea Bass amongst others THIS is the place to be! 
      We were here last night for my birthday, everything was perfect. Tino our waiter is awesome, he's always funny and cheerful, he knows the dishes and makes great recommendations! The rest of the wait staff is very quick to fill a drink or clear a plate or used silverware! 
      We've been here about six times in the past, we always see Chef Wes; he doesn't always have a chance to talk, he is usually cooking. Which if the chef is cooking I'm fine with, last night he stopped and asked us about our food, we were on dessert and we raved about the bread pudding and my wife loves their homemade Salted Caramel ice cream. 
     I hope too many people don't read this review, I'd hate to have a packed restaurant and have to wait to be seated!

I went to Table 34 for lunch on a few occasions after meetings or with coworkers. Every time I was impressed. I had a variety of items and each time everything was delicious. The servers are very friendly and food comes out in a timely manner. I would say the pricing is a little high on some of the items, but overall it is worth it!

I've always experienced excellent customer service before - and the other night was no exception. Friendly, efficient and courteous throughout. 

For starters, we had the oyster and scallop selection. Oysters were good, however a little on the small side. The scallops were prepared well and they went well with the sauce and sides. 

I had the steak special with grilled veggies. Prepared just right and a good sized portion. I didn't want too much as I wanted to save for dessert (somewhere else). 

My friend opted for the ribs special. Now her meat just slid off the bones. She also asked for mash and I really liked her dish better than mine. 

Both meals were delicious and the staff was awesome. It's a little on the pricey side however I'd still come back even if I didn't have a ton of gift cards to use up

Consistently great dining. Inventive, seasonal specials with a reliable menu of favorites. I can always count on a great meal, nicely crafted cocktails and desserts worth a splurge. Can we say fresh peach pie??? Table 34's ambience is perfect after a tough day at the office. Soft lighting, smooth service and a nice local crowd. I need to remember this gem on Warm Springs and the 215..

This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything on the menu is excellent--you can't go wrong. The ingredients are fresh and the food is delicious. They are very generous with their portions and reasonably priced. The wait staff and service is superb. All the staff is terrific, but my favorite waitress is Jeanenna. She makes you feel like you are getting 5-star treatment every time. Must try the beet salad, roasted vegetable with quinoa or the arugula and goat cheese salad. For dinner, the fish is always fresh, the ravioli are excellent, the rack of lamb impressive and the roasted chicken with the apple sage stuffing are just a few of my favorites.This is truly a gem in the Las Vegas off strip culinary world and you are missing out if you have not yet dinned here. One of the best restaurants in town!

If you're looking to expand your culinary horizons beyond Applebee's and Chili's, Table 34 is just the place for you. The food is unpretentious, solid and well prepared. Don't expect new culinary wonders to marvel at, but I guarantee you'll love what you have. It pains me to give this place a 3, but since our server was MIA for the majority of our meal I've come to the sad realization of how important service is. 

So in a nutshell we waited 45 minutes to order food after practically tackling our server to put in a drink order. Does that seem long- perhaps no, but we came dangerously close to polishing off our bottle of wine with no food in sight. In the midst of waiting to order we also ended up flagging down a bus boy to bring us water.. So our thirst was quenched, but we were starving. 

After placing our order we basically had to wave our arms around and grab a hurried server  to order drinks. Water refills were apparently a pipe dream and we ended up sharing water glasses and drinking way more liquor than need be..

40 minutes later our food arrives-- thank god- we were drunk and needed something to soak up the liquor. I ordered the shrimp with angel hair pasta and tomato basil sauce and thought it was tasty. I've had a similar entree many times before, so it was nothing exciting, but it was very good..

My family claims it was a fluke and service is usually excellent, but when you're left wondering if your server just decided to take a 2 hour break, a tasty meal with excellent company turns into a laborious dinner out...

We ate here for our 3rd Wedding Anniversary! For an Appetizer we had the Duck Quesadillas with grapes and blackberries, I chose the New York Strip with horseradish mashed potatoes and greens. Very delicious! Though we didn't indulge they had a large selection of wines that are sure to please. Thumbs up Table 34, you were good.

Found this elegant, delicious, quaint and perfect restaurant. My office is around the corner and it is a perfect lunch spots for clients or work colleagues. Will 100% each here again. Great service, quick food, very reasonable prices.
Easily the Best Restaurant in the Vegas valley.Chef Wes Kendrick really knows his stuff!!!

A little disappointed. 
We went there to catch a meal around 7-7:30pm and it wasn't very busy. The service was good. I more so liked their vision rather than the execution. I was practically drooling over every menu item. We ordered the Brie to start. It was wrapped in puff pastry and served with a small salad. We would have preferred some sort of bread or toast to place the Brie on like I've always had it served. The first round of Brie was still cold in the middle so we sent it back. Luckily they made us a whole new one and the second was cooked properly however the dish wasn't worth the anticipation. Just nothing that special. 

My date ordered the roasted vegetable salad with quinoa. She was intrigued by the selection of veggies it came with because it wasn't the normal selection. With veggies such as heart of Palm, artichoke hearts, etc. She enjoyed that but said her quinoa was too gritty. 

I had the herb roasted chicken. I enjoyed my dish. I normally don't get chicken dishes while out because I eat more than enough of it at home but the apple stuffing intrigued me. The dish display was on point. The stuffing ended up being a tad grease soaked it seemed, but the flavor was good along with the awesome veggies and properly cooked chicken. 

Overall, it was an alright place. I wont be making the drive back however.

This place has the best food and wine combination of any Las Vegas Strip restaurant. The pricing is very reasonable and I absolutely loved the waiter's description of the menu. I'm going to definitely start eating here regularly.

This place has to be one of the best elegant dining experiences I ever had. The wait staff was just delightful. Chef Wes Kendrick came out and chatted with us and all we can say was how amazing his dishes were with flavor and tenderness. It's restaurant week and the dishes we chose were simply amazing. We started out with the duck tacos and clams in garlic wine sauce, they were amazing. Our entrees were the lobster mac and cheese, and the tenderloin, again amazing. Our desserts were the vanilla bean creme brulee and the chocolate peanut butter cake, simply decadent and amazing. I will return to explore their regular menu.

I came here with a colleague and I ordered the Mahi Mahi lunch special and it was bad.  The fish was grilled and it came with a side salad.  The fish was a good size but it tasted and smelled very fishy where I only ate 4 bites.  They drizzled the fish with a Thai sweet and sour sauce.  I'll try this place again but will stay away from their seafood.

Spring Restaurant Week 2013

This place was packed! It was crazy loud in there. We were both starving so we wanted to order immediately. 

Buffalo Fried Shrimp with Creamy Cole Slaw, these were good but it only came with 3 shrimp. 

Herb Roasted Jidori Chicken with Apple-Sage Dressing, Vegetables and Natural Jus, this was delicious. It tasted even better the next day and I usually hate leftovers.

Lemon Cheesecake for dessert, this was my least favorite.

Our food took close to an hour to come out, the app took a long time to come out and then dinner came out really close after that. I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt because it was busy. I would come back to try some other menu items for sure.
This place has great food but for me it is  a bit pricey. It is more of a fine dining place but i dont think it has to cost a lot to be good. With that being said i still would go back to try more.

Tried this place out for dinner on a weekday so it wasn't too crowded and our party of 6 were seated without a wait. I had been meaning to try this place out for a while now but wasn't really sure what to expect. The presentation of food was nice but I have to admit the actual food did not impress. This is not to say it was bad - it was all average to above average but I guess I expected more from its good reviews and word of mouth reputation. As others have mentioned the duck appetizer was pretty good and I think duck may be one of their strong suits.

I wasn't too impressed with our server and we had some left over pizza that he packed up for us to go. He actually put the two slices together cheese on cheese like a sandwich and then squished it a little into a ball shape to make it fit in one of the very small takeout boxes. Not what I would expect from the care with which the food is generally prepared and presented at this restaurant.

A real gem. I didn't demand much, just pizza. But the attentive service is excellent without being overbearing. And their complimentary table bread was over the top.

Worth a visit.

As good as it gets in Vegas (or anywhere else for that matter)!

Been here 3 or 4 times, actually every time I come to Vegas, and it never disappoints! My fiance drools anytime I mention the words Table and 34 in the same breath, and I wouldn't put it past him to fly to Vegas just to eat here. I'm a vegetarian, but the mac and cheese is to die for!

Great smallish restaurant to enjoy while you're selling your soul in sin city.

Used to come here all the time when it was Wild Sage (same chef), have not been in quite the same habit since Table 34 was opened.  Back when it was Wild Sage, it was one of the few better dining options in this part of town.

Food and service is very good, both at lunch and dinner.  Salads, sandwiches, wraps, soups, entrees are all very good.  Have had an excellent nouveau version of mac and cheese here (not sure if it is still on the menu), bbq wrap, ahi salad and other items are lunch favorites.

Menu is a bit static, yet high quality, they might be well served by a little more rotation, variety, or a broader range of specials.

Recommended.  This looks to be a good quality local small business that is important to support to have a diversity of choice and to support small businesses in Las Vegas.

Well hello hidden gem! Nice to meet you! I'm Nikki and I'm obsessed with you now! 

So, last minute dinner ideas were a'pondering, and we opted for Table 34! First time here and definitely not the last. We were sat quickly close to their patio dining area. Beautiful set up. Reminds me of small cafes in Brooklyn. White tablecloths but a casual atmosphere. 

The first thing I ask is "what's table 34?" The host told us that when it was the previous restaurant many years ago, table 34 was the only big round table and was their VIP section! All the cool kids sat there! I love places with history and good stories.
