Now to the food. We started with a dozen oysters. Half Rockefeller and half raw on the hair shell. *drool* they were amazing and fresh! 

Then we had the Crispy Fried Artichoke Hearts w/ Spicy Lemon Aioli and Field Greens.. this might be my favorite artichokes dish ever. The spicy aioli are what dreams are made of. 

The Riesling Poached Pear Salad, Endive, Blue Cheese and Walnut Oil Vinaigrette was fresh, the vinaigrette was a nice kind of different. 

Finished it off with the mediterranean pizza. If I was on death row. This would be on my last meal menu. That's the kind of good it is. We just ate there and I want to go back again today just for this pizza. It had Pesto, Ricotta, Artichokes, Olives, Onions & Arugula. Yum

Love it! 
Come here! 
Eat a lot! 
Order me pizza! 

Happy Yelping!

This is a locals secret. The food is as good as anything on the Strip at half the cost. Chef Wes changes his menus from time to time so it is always exciting.  The service is great. We seem to generally get Tino. Ask for him and you will be happy.  If you are a local, check it out- you will be happy.  If you are a tourist, stay on the strip.

ABSOLUTELY AWESOME !!

is the only way I can describe this restaurant...after having a horrible experience at Mario Batali's Otto on the strip the day before, this luncheon experience was delightful from start to finish...fabulous white bean soup...the chicken pot pie is the best I've ever eaten, excellent bbq chicken wrap, and the two great desserts we shared...thanks for a wonderful dining experience Elisha...our son Reid appreciated your wonderful tableside manner...we'll be back the next time we visit Las Vegas.

Hello my new favorite restaurant!  

First, let me start with saying that this place is not Michael's Gourmet Room, Restaurant Guy Savoy, etc., which I usually reserve my 5 stars for.  But putting Table 34 in context of a local restaurant with similar price points, you just can't beat it.  Not only is the food a nice fusion of French and Italian for a new American twist and wonderful flavor, but the portion sizes are generous and the price point is affordable.  The staff is wonderful, although the restaurant is on the smaller size.  If you want to try this fabulous place, you should make a reservation.  I would recommend everything.  my friends and I each ordered different things and everyone loved what they ordered.  I can't wait to try something new the next time I go.

We planned on drinks at the bar prior to dinner, however it was so small and already full that we weren't able to. Dinner was okay, nothing to rave about. The so called specials were more expensive than the entrees listed on the menu. The wine list was disappointing. The restaurant had a cafeteria feel to it, I expected it to be more contemporary and elegant. This is definitely the hang out place for the older crowd...I'm 29 and felt out of place dining here.

Where did this place come from? 

Snuggled up to the 215 and Warm Springs, Table 34 has a slightly elevated menu that offers everything from Buffalo Fried Shrimp with Creamy Cole Slaw to a massive Grilled Rack of Pork with Chipotle Potato Puree, Asparagus & Hard Cider Glaze. Literally you're sloppy unemployed best friend and your uptight foodie buddy would both love this place. 

I came here to drop off some toys for the "Toys for Tater Tots" promo and I was immensely surprised at the happy hour menu offerings. I felt like I literally ordered everything; Duck Carnitas Tacos, Buffalo Fried Shrimp, Kobe Beef Sliders with Caramelized Onions and Swiss Cheese, Macaroni & Cheese with Peas & Pancetta, and of course the Sweet Potato Tater Tots with Honey Mustard. 

Everything was very good, honestly I didn't have a bad dish, the shrimp was on point; spicy and the pieces were huge. The sliders were delicious, super juicy and the onions weren't overpowering, and the mac and cheese was, "food bonerirffic". My only complaint was that there wasn't enough, give me more!

The Duck Carnitas were delicious, tender and the perfect bite sized morsels for the non-sharing person. Sweet potato tots, I these fried, sweet carby treasures are paired perfect with a honey mustard for that nice bite at the end. 

The service was attentive and kept the table clear as each order came and went. I will say this place does have an older crowd. I mean, I'm no spring chicken, but I was the probably the youngest person here by at least 12 years. Is this a bad thing? Nope, now I have a solid spot to take my mom for those weekly dinner outings.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while since all of the pictures looked pretty good and the ratings seemed pretty high so I finally got to try them about a week and a half ago and they were just eh for food and for service.
Everyone eating inside at the time were all in business attire, probably from all the offices in the same complex and I feel that since we were in more casual attire, our server didn't treat us the same. He was very inattentive and spacey. I ordered the Scottish Salmon for $18.50 and my boyfriend got the Wild Mushroom Pizza for I believe $12.95. The foodrunner brought out the salmon and pizza together however the pizza they brought out was something with a bunch of pepperoni on it and when we told him we didn't order that, he kind of just held it there and said "Well would you like this one instead?" Lmao! I've never had that happen before. Pretty funny and we were like no...my boyfriend isn't eating meat today...and so he took it back and asked me if I still wanted my salmon. Well ya, the salmon was what I ordered lol. The server then stopped by and quickly said "Sorry, put it in wrong" and quickly walked away. Uhhh okay no problem I guess?? lol I was almost done with my salmon when they finally brought out the pizza. 
Now onto flavor. The salmon was a nice portion but very under-seasoned and wasn't memorable at all. Very bland. I had to put quite a bit of salt on it. The pizza had a good flavor but the crust was pretty soggy.
Our server then walked by and dropped off the check without saying anything. What a weird experience. Overall we probably won't be coming back since there's a lot more options down the street on Eastern and on Las Vegas Blvd.

Such a nice place !!  The food is consistently delicious, and every day there is a yummy special on top of their already great menu.  I enjoy the atmosphere, and can always count on a good meal and good service when I take my friends there.

Wow! I wish I had known Table 34 existed. I ordered the Rubin with Potato salad at the advice of my server. The combined  flavors were a mouth full of wonderful. I recommend this place as an off the strip alternative for lunch. Love! Love! Love!

Very attentive staff. Even though it was busy on a Thursday afternoon, it seems like there was a waiter/waitress for every 3-4 tables. 

I ordered their special, a pasta dish with wild boar meatballs. Not only did I feel super manly eating it, but it was delicious too.

What an off the beaten path treat in Vegas.... Thanks to yelp we found this gem and trusted the reviews of the yelp community.  We called ahead and were assured that we would not need reservations for an unusually early dinner given our airport departure.  The restaurant filled up soon after our arrival.  Our wait person was so knowledgeable...spouting off the details of the menu and all its nuances in perfect Italian dialect, which truly added to the authenticity of our experience.  Among the four of us, we ordered lobster mac n'cheese for the table then an order of ribs, two orders of Sole , ribs and a shrimp pasta dish.  The food was fresh, prepared with flare and exceeded our expectations.  We ordered amazing desserts and left the restaurant in that almost too full but I don't care state.

I've known this restaurant through it's many incarnations, since I've lived in the southeast for more than 20 years.  I have to say that this time, they have got it right!  Picture classic bistro in Manhattan, and you have got an idea of this restaurant.  This was so good that after dining here with friends, my husband and I came back the following Saturday to have the entrees we did NOT choose the first time because they looked so good as they were taken to other tables.  I loved their salad, their scallops and their steak.  My husband enjoyed the fall-off-the-bone (but not OVERCOOKED) short ribs - everything was great, the bread, the drinks, the service.  An unqualified 5 star experience.  Expensive but worth every penny!

Very nice! We went here on our weekly sojourn and were very happy we did.  We arrived right at 11:00 because we had read the reviews and did not want to risk standing in line.  We were seated promptly and were served our drinks immediately.  I had the butternut squash soup and It was very good.  I also had the beet salad with goat cheese and candied pecans.  Awesome.
I had the pork chop with chipotle potatoes and it was out of this world.  The potatoes were very interesting and went perfect with the sauce.  She had the pastrami sandwich with fries and was equally impressed.  The pastrami was incredibly tender.  Our waitress was very attentive and pleasant as well as all of the staff.  This is the kind of place that makes dining out a pleasure.  It is so nice to go to a place where quality products are perfectly melded with a knowledgeable and efficient staff .  We will be back.

.. most places make it ordinary.. 
..these guys consistently make it 'special'..
.. hands down, one of the best ..
..and they never act like they're taking anything for granted
..and can enjoy it in addition..
..impressive..
Read about the vegan friendly menu so we decided to check this place out. The wait staff was great and the food was fantastic. It is a bit pricey but it is also worth it. We will definitely be back

If there is a food heaven, this is it! Everything was perfection from my Lemon Drop martini to the end of the perfect meal. Executive Chef Wes Kendrick has crafted a menu using the highest quality, freshest meat and seafood, beautifully presented, using his own signature sauces to compliment them. Our waiter, Tino, was attentive to our every need. Everyone who worked there seemed genuinely concerned with giving us the best of everything. Table 34 is a gem off the strip, providing the best meal in Las Vegas! Go there and you won't be disappointed. There was not one negative. Thank you!

Table 34 has been on our to do list for a while. We finally experienced it during Restaurant Week. The dining room is nicely decorated with wall mirrors and art. Table spacing is comfortable and the room at about three quarter capacity was conversation friendly. 
Our server Tino was friendly, helpful with the menu and followed up throughout the evening. The bar tender stopped by to check on our satisfaction with the cocktails. She makes a wonderful lemon drop martini.! 
The Restaurant Week menu had a wide variety of choices for the three courses. 
Our first course started with Wedge of crisp Iceberg with a creamy ranch dressing. The Duck Confit Tacos (3) were served with pico de gallo and fresh limes.. The duck was juicy and plentiful.
Second course Char-Broiled C.A.B. Tenderloin with roasted potatoes and vegetables. The steak was tender and cooked perfectly as requested. Fresh vegetables were firm not overcooked. The Seared Sea Scallops were served with spinach, mixed vegetables, a potato puree and orange glaze. Three beautiful firm scallops. A great melt in your mouth dish from the sea. 
The desert course required much thought because there were many wonderful choices. In the end it was carrot cake and lemon cheesecake. The carrot cake was moist and had a fantastic taste. The slice was a large portion. The lemon cheesecake was served with mixed berries and whipped cream. The cake was the perfect balance of sweet and tart.

On this evening Chef Kendrick was making the rounds and talking to the customers. He stopped by our table before and after dinner. I expressed my enjoyment of the excellent preparation of the food and the beautiful presentation. Even though the drive is across town, Table 34 is now on our short list and I am sure we will return before the next Restaurant Week.

I really liked this place! The food was excellent and the ambiance was just as nice. Not to mention my super finicky cousin who went with me absolutely loved the salmon with the cauliflower puree. It's definitely a place that we will be visiting again.

Two of us had dinner here on Oct. 13, 2015.  We had just landed and gotten our rental car. It was almost 8pm (11 pm for us from eastern time zone). So we looked for a restaurant we could get to quickly without going to the Strip. We searched Yelp and decided to come here, surely not more than 5 minutes from the airport. As soon as we walked in I knew we chose a good place. Full of local customers and from their conversations with the staff I'd say all were frequent diners.

Everything is ala carte with entrees mostly priced from mid-$20's to mid-$30's. So if you don't mind those prices, this is an excellent place to dine. A serving of various rolls and butter are brought to the table. We shared an appetizer special of the night - flash fried peppers with dipping sauce.  Forget how much it cost, put probably about $10. They were cooked perfectly, had a little heat, nice sauce and more than we could both eat. For an entrée I had the pork chops at $29.00. Two nice sized pork chops and grilled perfectly. Served with chipotle potato puree that was very good with a little kick and pencil asparagus that were also cooked perfectly. As if perfectly cooked wasn't enough what put it over the top was the hard cider glaze.  Absolutely delicious. My son opted for the rack of lamb at $33.75. Really a very nice portion. Three double sized chops with lots of meat on them. Served in a brandy peppercorn sauce with a potato fennel galette and seasonal vegetables. Again all was cooked perfectly and delicious. Coffee and a shared flourless chocolate cake finished our dinner.

Atmosphere is warm, contemporary and classy with white table cloths on all tables. Our waiter was excellent and another server made sure our water glasses were full, not waiting for them to be empty but refilling them constantly. To sum it up - We enjoyed an outstanding dinner complimented by excellent service.

Excellent is the only word to describe this place. Excellent service. Excellent staff. Excellent food. Absolutely excellent experience. I had the grilled New York steak with horseradish potatoes (absolutely to die for!) and seared veggies. I also got a chance to try the lobster cakes which were light, fluffy, and decadent. Truly a wonderful find on my business trip. I'll definitely be back!

Overall I enjoyed my experience eve at Table 34. Portions were huge and the wait staff was solid, although not as knowledgeable as I would have hoped as their win knowledge and prices of their specials were non existent. 

We had the special Serrano peppers and the garlic chicken fettuccine and the golden trout as our entrees. And then a few wines each. We each thoroughly enjoyed our meals and were very full. I would say the trout was better than the pasta but both were solid. The bread, especially the apple walnut bread, was exceptional. 

I would say Table 34 is worth a go if (1) you're a local and want a nice restaurant off the strip, or (2) are in the Town Square area and want to have a great meal. Table 34 will not fill your pallet similar to a strip restaurant, by our bill was under $100 for 2 filling entrees, a shared appetizer, and 4 drinks total, which is very rare for a quality meal in the area.   Table 34 is worth a go for sure. .

Have wanted to try Table 34 since reading many good reviews and having seen them listed on several "best of" lists.  The restaurant is casual yet has a modern design with white table clothes and an inviting feel.  Staff appears to be very knowledgeable about the food and were very attentive to my dining.  Started with the Oysters on the half shell, very fresh New Zealand oysters opted for a champagne vinaigrette since they did not have the traditional mignonette. Followed with a salad--the special Burrata, which consisted of mixed greens, red grapes, fresh figs and the most amazingly fresh mozzarella--a very enjoyable salad.  Wanted to have a fish dish, so I had the Grilled Maine Sea Scallops with Braised Greens and Dijon Bar-b-que Sauce--the scallops were grilled very delicately prepared with a hint of bar-b-que sauce that sweetened them, the greens consisted of chard and kale which I found to be too strong for the delicate scallops. I followed this with the Quail, Jack Daniels Marinated, with Mixed Greens and Roasted Garlic Dressing--the quail was wonderful, and the Jack Daniels marinate enhanced the flavor of the quail.  My main course was the special of the day--wild boar roasted with a port and cherry reduction, very well prepared and I enjoyed how the sauce balanced well with the pork. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the meal was very good, also had the opportunity to meet and converse with the chef--Wes Kendrick.  Thank you and I can definitely recommend this as a place to visit and get to know.

You have to look for this as it is in an unusual area but well worth the hunt.
It's not your average Restuarant but well worth your time. You will not be disappointed.

This place is not on the strip and that is one of the things that drew me here when I had a three hour wait for my flight out.  Delicious and not at all diet friendly reuben, but it had been a rough week and it was only Tuesday.  The place is hopping at lunchtime.  The service is great and the wine list was at least sufficient.  I would be interested in trying out other options on my next trip.

We had an appetizer of the duck confit quesadillas, they were very savory and not greasy. They were on a bed of greens with a sweet vinegar dressing with beets, grapes and blackberries. I ordered one of the specials which was the trout with green vegetables and rice pilaf. I'm not a fan of capers but it complimented the trout very well with a lemony butter sauce. Everything tastes very fresh. I was impressed with the service and the quality of food. You definitely get what you pay for. I would absolutely recommend and go again. The portions are perfect, not too much and not too little!

This is by far my favorite place to eat! The scallops are to die for! I mean it. I dream about them. The service is always spectacular, and the prices are reasonable for the outstanding quality of food.  Oh and the bacon and gouda pizza. Everything is amazing! I can't wait to return!!!
i work nearby, and this is a perfect spot for lunch.  great food, quick service, and very friendly staff.  once you're inside, you don't even remember that you're in a strip mall.

Dined here several times over the last couple of years and it's always been spot on! Creative menu options can pretty much accommodate any taste without being the boring Strip fare. Fresh ingredients and great preparation FTW! 
Service has always been exceptional- attentive without feeling stuffy or pressured. Staff has always been knowledgeable about the menu and pairings. They've always added to the positive experience. 
Small and intimate setting with no pretentiousness. I've never been on a weekend night, so can't comment about weekend crowds. It's almost an undiscovered gem. If you're sick of the Strip scene and the monotonous, try Table 34.

Love this place. However my review is limiting since I've only ever had the lamb salad. It's fantastic!!!! Prob have been here a dozen or so times when in the area for work. The other food looks great too but I wouldn't know as too busy get my lamb salad on.

Super nice restaurant, food is good, staff friendly, if you want to have lunch be there 11:00 am because it get busy after that time. 
Prices are reasonable.
You can sit outside.

I'm not going to ding them for just one visit.   We had a very nice dinner,  made reservations before had even though in a weeknight at 5 pm it was pretty open.  They were personable. Wine, Roasted Duck, Sea Scallop entree and Linguine and chicken was ordered.  Everything tasted fine,  nothing over the top where we went "wow"!!  Would have liked to try the Happy Hour Menu, but you need to sit at the bar area for that.  I think next visit, I will be a little more informed.

We don't usually go for this type of place-it's a bit fancy and I don't like checking my attire before eating in a restaurant. Regardless, this place is SO worth it! 

Their food is amazing! Their service is highest caliber and their desserts are delicious. The location is awesome (right off the 215) and the restaurant itself is not too big. They have a nice outdoor seating area, too. 

I highly recommend if you want a local fine-dining experience.

I was one of the guests that dined with this group, the one that arrived late actually.

From one chef to another, I respect those that are in my profession and feel that criticisms should be directed to those that are in the position to make a difference.

Most of the time our group was there, Chef Kendrick chef/owner was in the dining room. He even glanced over at our table several times, making direct eye contact with me.  I regret not sharing my concerns with him.  Chef Kendrick is free to email me.

It has been a few years since I have been at the restaurant since I'm not in this part of town, but last night we went to Town Square to walk around and grab dinner.  We ended up walking around, but everywhere we went it was packed and we didn't want to wait 30 min for a table.

So I convinved my wife to hop in the car and run down the street 5 min away down Warm Springs.

At 8:30 there were 5 other tables and we walked right in.

Chef Wes and his team did a great job! My wife had a great steak and I had the swordfish which was wonderful.

Only issue I had was with a cocktail that didn't taste right, but my server corrected that quickly.

Service was great and food was wonderful.   We will be back soon!

Kind of hesitant to write a review about this restaurant. Reason being, the food and wine is outstanding. What makes me hesitant is that in the future I do not want to have to compete against other customers for a seat at the table.  I had an all around great experience. The menu covers a vast array of dishes loved by all. The Seafood taste like it was just caught and the desserts were rediculiously good! The lemon cheese cake, best i have had. Chef and team thanks!

Went there during lunchtime with my coworker. To my surprise, it wasn't that packed. Wait time is average, neither slow nor fast.
We got a Reuben and pastrami sandwich - which were delicious!
They both came with sides that you can pick from: fruits, potato salads, french fries, and I think there were few more items. Service was great!

All in all, I will definitely come back here.

A super busy little spot with very fancy sounding food. Portions are decent at lunch and the waitstaff is very attentive. Their bison burger is consistently good and the potato salad is pretty tasty as well.
Off the beaten path with very nice ambiance. Apps and entrees were excellently prepared and wait staff perfectly attentive. A nice diversion from the hotel and a best-kept secret for the locals.
Went here recently for daughter's birthday.  As always, excellent service,food good, but pricey.  One of our favorite places.

Absolutely love this place! Our favorite contemporary place off the strip. Wes, the Executive Chef, checks up on customers to make sure things are going well. They have a happy hour menu. Their specials are always amazing. I love the oysters and the shrimp gnocchi in vodka sauce is by far the best gnocchi I have ever had. They also have a lunch menu. I have only ever been to dinner but I'm sure the lunch is equally amazing.
I can't really make up my mind on how I feel about this place. The menu just seemed to have strange options on it, but what I did taste was good. Some of it was a little overpriced for what it was.

Met a couple of colleagues for lunch the other day and saw @Matt S review that mentioned a Pastrami Melt....so I went for it with Fries.  I wasn't paying, so I didn't get the price....I think it was around $7.95.

The Sandwich came out pretty fast.  It tasted pretty good, but the Bread was greasy!  I understand it's a melt, so it should be kind of like a Grilled Cheese Sandwich.....but it was much more oily than that.  The Fries were excellent and the service was very good as usual.

This place gets packed for lunch, especially during the weekdays, so get there before Noon if you don't want to wait.

Return Factor - 75%

Table 34 is one of my favorite little restaurants in Las Vegas. I had dined in and ordered take out at this place, and I have never been disappointed. The food is always pretty tasty, with my two favorite entrees being the sauteed scallops and the seared Atlantic salmon. I also love how it is a locally owned establishment, and Chef Wes (who is also the owner) often stops our table by to make sure we are pleased with the food. Service is fast and excellent. The decor is modern, and the ambiance is intimate. Table 34 is a testimony to good management and great food.

I went to this restaurant for a first date and have been coming here regularly ever since. The food is amazing and so is the service. 

The roasted corn chowder, scallops, and salmon are my favorites. One time I went and they had lobster cakes for an appetizer special so if they have those available when you go then get them. They are so yummy. 

Really good restaurant and even better food.
Nice place to eat. We ordered the New York steak and it was cooked to perfection. But, In my opinion this place is too pricey.

This is hands down my favorite restaurant to go to in Vegas! The service is incredible and I always feel welcome when I'm there! My favorite dish hands down is the lamb, which is usually what I end up ordering. Don't find anything too quickly on the menu until you listen to their long list of specials! When they're available, the crab cakes should NOT be passed! They are amazing and come with a creamy spicy dipping sauce and lemon to squeeze on top. Give this place a try, you will not be disappointed!!

Better than we remembered!
We haven't been here for years since we moved to a different part of town, but we went back tonight for a quiet birthday dinner and had two of the best plates of food we've ever had.  We sat down and perused the ever-changing menu, hoping for Ribeye and not finding it, but when Janine ran down the specials for us, Ribeye and Sea Bass were both there - our favorites!  We ordered one of each and for the first time, I couldn't decide which was better, they were both delicious.  The Ribeye was cooked perfectly and seasoned so nicely, it supported the flavor instead of overwhelming it.  The sea bass was tender and melted in my mouth, perfectly seasoned - again without overpowering the delicate fish  The supporting sides were also fantastic, my wife even ate the cooked carrots for the first time that I've ever seen in over 20 years!  We came back later for a memorably perfect creme brulee, Awesome experience!
This place is great for casual or formal dining - very Vegas in that you can wear shorts or a tie, and you get fantastic service either way.  From the moment we were greeted to the time we left, we were taken care of as well as any fine dining experience we've ever had.  We need to come back more often!

Service without a smile. That is the summary. It was felt by the entire group that had lunch at Table 34 today that the waitress felt she was getting an automatic tip so she did not have to do much. Service was very slow even with  most of the tables empty.

The food was ok but nothing to write home about or even to take home.

This restaurant has been one of my favorites since it's Wild Sage days. Over the years I've tried almost everything on the menu. The food is amazing. Chef Wes Kendrick is the best in town.
The service is impressive, the place is so clean you could eat off the floor.

If you are going to Table 34 for top notch food then you will be disappointed.  The food was just average and a little pricy for lunch.

If you are going to Table 34 for top quality wait staff, then stay away from this place.  Or, at least until they get rid of the surly, female waitress we had.

We were a group of 7 people and when we arrived at the restaurant on a Thursday at 1pm and the restaurant was fairly full.  By the time we were ready to order, the restaurant was nearly empty.

Sodas were flat and they had to be replaced.  One guest who arrived late had to wait 20 minutes for a glass of water to arrive.

The Waitress never checked on us after the meals were served.

The Waitress never followed up after the meal to see if we wanted coffee or dessert.

One guest requested mustard for his sandwich.  That arrived after his meal was finished.

At the end of the meal it became obvious that all of us were disenchanted with the wait service so we spoke to the Manager about the situation.  The Manager was defensive and never once apologized for the service.  The Waitress overheard our complaints and thought it was her place to step in and argue & defend her surly attitude with 7 customers and then huffed off.

The restaurant needs to get rid of the Manager and the Waitress if they want people to return to this restaurant.

It should be noted that this company does not have a website.  And, their restaurant is off the beaten path in an office park, thereby making it difficult to find.

None of us will be returning to this restaurant.

This was a wonderful find in Vegas. I'm always on the road for work so finding interesting restaurants becomes part of the adventure. After reading other yelp reviews and the fact that is was very close to my hotel I decided to give Table 34 a try....it lived up to my expectations and more. As another yelper noted, this is clearly a locals restaurant, located south of the strip and the airport, you have to know to go here otherwise you will miss this gem. You don't even notice it from the street.

Since I travel alone for work I look for 3 things in a restaurant: 1. good food 2. good company 3. good environment. This place had all three in spades. I started with the burrata salad, an off the menu special. It was fresh and satisfying. Dressing was superb. For my main I had the rack of lamb. The wine reduction sauce was rich and flavorful- paired with seasonal vegetables and horseradish mash potatoes.  Note, the potatoes that were originally paired with this dish were not available- the bartender recommended these instead and said they were better anyway-- I believe she is correct.

I sat at the bar where Adrienne served me drinks, food and wonderful conversation. I had no problem taking my time with my meal and drink and chatting with the Adrienne and one of her friends that frequents the bar. Adrienne made my experience immensely more intimate and enjoyable. Toward the end of my dining experience as I closed out the restaurant, the owner joined our conversation. She was very warm and enjoyed chatting with everyone.

The environment is classy but those looking for a casual dining experience would still feel at home. 

I highly recommend Table 34. I will definitely return here during another trip Vegas.

Absolute most horrible service I've ever encountered before in my life.  Came in tonight at 7:30 PM, was seated immediately and then that's about where it stopped.  Ordered drinks and took 15 minutes to receive.  Didn't have ginger beer for a Moscow mule and didn't have any Smirnoff vodka.  Thirty minutes went by and our server Elena, never even took our order.  Walked by us probably about four or five times.  After over 40 minutes of waiting to take our order we decided to say to ourselves f this place and move on.  The matre'd didn't even apologize or offer to comp the drinks.  Paid for the overpriced drinks and server expected a tip asking if I wanted change.  I don't think so! Worse service ever and I WILL not be coming back again!  Seriously after the long ass wait, the server seemed almost confused as to why we were leaving.  Yelpers, please use high caution coming to this place if you value your time which is an extremely high commodity nowadays.  No apology or nothing, NEVER AGAIN!

This is a GREAT little neighborhood restaurant!  So friendly and welcoming!  I travel often for business, so when finding somewhere quaint and friendly it is so refreshing!  The food and the service was amazing.  Thank you for a nice evening!

*** Review is for Restaurant Week 2018 menu ***

This is another restaurant that I've been going to try for many years and somehow never made it here.  I came for Restaurant Week.  I have never seen such a large selection for the courses on a RW menu.

I was seated immediately and brought my iced tea quickly, too service sooAfter looking over the choices--more than I had been looking at online--I ordered the fried shrimp with cider glaze and served with a mound of cole slaw in the center.  The shrimp were great and the cider glaze was very, very good.  I took a piece of bread and wiped the plate clean of any leftover glaze.

Next came the lobster macaroni and cheese.  The cheese was English white cheddar and there were bits of asparagus mixed in with the cheese and a good number of lobster pieces.  The only thing is it needed a small bit of salt even with the cheese.  It looked like a small serving until you started to eat it which I did at my leisure and with enjoyment.  Chef Kendrick walked by and asked me how the mac and cheese was and he got a big smile when I told him how good it was.

For RW, you can choose any dessert off their normal menu.  My server, Tino, told me there was another dessert tonight not on the menu--small cronuts served with caramel ice cream.  I had to try it.  I'm surely glad I did because it's not something you see elsewhere and I rarely go to doughnut shops.  With the cronuts was caramel ice cream with bits of chocolate mixed in.  It was a different dessert for sure.

The staff in the restaurant worked as a team.  One person came over and removed an empty sweet and low packet.  Another brought my different courses and yet another refilled my iced tea.  Tino was quite friendly and answered questions I had.  One of the best Restaurant Week meals I've had!  I'll be back.

This was my first time visiting this place for lunch! I had a good experience overall. The food was very good and the service was equally as good. The place was busy, but we were still seated right away and the food came out fast. 

Gluten Free: Although the server did not know of many options, she did go check with the kitchen to confirm the soup was gluten free. I ordered a burger with no bun and it was very good! I would be interested in the future to find out if they can make other things off the lunch menu gluten free. 

Overall good experience and we will be back to this place!

Excellent service, clean cute restaurant with amazing food. The owner makes sure everything is made fresh daily. She worked for Wolfgang Puck for 10 years and her quality rivals anything you'll eat on the strip.  
This little unassuming gem in a strip plaza is worth a stop. The corn purée saffron soup was quite good as were both entrees we had for lunch. The daily special of grilled swordfish was tenter, juicy and very flavorful. The fresh pineapple salsa was a beautiful acidic compliment to the fish and the grilled scallop salad had elements with amazing flair and texture.  This is a definite repeat. If I had to give one ding it would be the hibiscus tea...even after watering down it was too strong, but it could be me since it's a strong flavor to begin with...
Thank you table 34 for a surprising treat at a very reasonable price given the quality!  See when we're back in town!

I understand why everyone goes here, it's got great proximity to a lot of office space and is a higher end place. It's not very good though, in my opinion; I mean the food is fine but it's not as good as the price would indicate. Sure, it's a notch above Subway next door but come on, it's not that great. I only go here when others are paying but I'd rather go elsewhere.

Fast service - we got our food right away. I had the New York strip steak. It was cooked perfectly and super delicious. I raised beef for 40 years and I'm very particular when it comes to steak. The staff was friendly and they serve Justin wine. A sweet little restaurant that would become a favorite go-to place if I lived here.

Very friendly, quiet restaurant with good, friendly service. I love their simple green salad, both fish and ribs are very satisfying. I had the Branzino last time, and it was cooked perfectly. Very satisfying.
We ordered the layered eggplant and crisp bacon Gouda pizza, one word....fantastic. Food was great, service was spot on, and pricing was good. What a hidden gem in Las Vegas!

WOW!  This has to be my new favorite place to eat in Las Vegas!  My mom had a restaurant.com coupon she wanted to use.  After eating there, I must say, "You have to try this place"!  

My dad had the NY Strip topped with Blue Cheese paired with Horseradish potatoes and mixed veggies.  I stole some of his potatoes....awesome!  When I go back, I hope these are on the menu!  My mom ordered the Scallops, also paired with mixed greens and plain mashed potatoes.  The scallops were so meaty and large...really tasty!  I ordered the Beef Tenderloin with mixed greens and baked, sliced potatoes.  Everything was amazing!  My only wish would to have the blue cheese on top of the Beef Tenderloin, paired with the Horseradish potatoes.  Now that would be a taste treat delight!  

Desert was even better...my parents and I split the crème brulee and the dessert of the night, which was a peanut butter slice topped with peanuts, peanut butter brittle on a Oreo crust.  Yummy!  Their coffee was also delicious and went wonderful with dessert.

What I thought was very interesting was the chef was out on the main floor most of the night talking to guest, making sure everything was to our liking, checking out different wines, etc.  Very unique touch and very personable.  Our waiter was very attentive and checked on us regularly.  I also like that the menu changes regularly, maybe even nightly.  There are unique meats and seafood on the menu. The atmosphere was really plain but warm.  It reminded me of restaurants and bars in Seattle.  I really enjoyed my entire experience here.  I can't wait to go back with my husband!

Came here with a friend many months back and I'm glad I tried them out.

My friend and I arrived on a saturday evening at 5:30pm and the place was empty but started filling up at about 6pm.

We were greeted and seated immediately and everything about the place was intimate and classy. My friend and I came here because we were celebrating my birthday and wanted to have a girls night out.

I ordered the oven roasted rosemary chicken and tomato soup and it was one of the best chicken dinners I've ever had in a long time. My friend had the fettuccine dish with a salad and she liked it very much. We ended our meal with a cheese cake we split between us and it was great.

Our bill came to about $80 with tip and tax, which wasn't that bad for the amazing food and service we experienced. I'd definitely come back again when I'm in the area.

Great job table 34!

We came here for lunch based on reviews. First of all, this place is not nearly as good as I thought it was going to be. Second, it's loud, too loud for us. I tried the Tuna Melt and it was as basic and plain as any I've had anywhere. My friend tried the Pastrami and had two bites and did not finish. Another friend had the Shrimp Salad and it was overly spicy and she could not finish. 
Won't be back and would not recommend.
Quiet, dim light setting. Great food and service. We got the wedge blue cheese salad, winter salad special and the truffle mushroom tagliatelle special. Would definitely recommend!
The service, the food are what you expect at Tabe-34...amazing.. The food is alway delicious and the service is fantastic.

Really nice easy going atmosphere and good service makes this place a solid choice. A date night with a good woman where you can dress casual and its quiet helps too.

My pork chops with sweet potatoes were on point. Nothing great but acceptable. Appetizer was a duck quesadilla with a blackberry coulis was a little too heavy. I think I should of skipped this and went straight for chops.
Great place off-Strip, where the locals go. Food is fresh, healthy, and tasty. Friendly service and warm atmosphere. It was hopping when I was there for lunch, so reservation is recommended.

I came here for business meeting and really liked the food. They have good customer service. The waiter that dropped off the food seemed a little serious and made no conversation where the meals went. My sprite didnt taste so good but their overall service is above average.

Went there at the last minute with four colleagues who were about to board the redeye to NYC.  Good choice!  The place was empty at 6pm on a Saturday night....but filled up before we left 90 minutes later.  
Ambiance was surprisingly nice (considering its stripmall environ), Tony, the maitre d was pleasant upon arrival and he sat us at a very nice table.  Our waiter was pleasant, funny and helpful.

The food was excellent. I had the shrimp salad appetizer and the chicken entree.  Both were very tasty.  At the table there was at least one special quail appetizer, a simple mixed green salad and the lobster bisque.  No complaints about any of these.  For entrees, we had the duck (rave review), the salmon (ditto) and one guy had the ravioli.  He thought the ravioli filling was sparse, but the sauce was excellent.

We had two bottles of a 2006 Shiraz that was excellent and moderately priced at $28.  Prices overall were decent for Las Vegas...certainly a bit less than you would find on the Strip or at a major casino.  

Dinner finished with coffee (fresh) and one spectacular brown/ice cream/whipped cream dessert.  Wow.  This meal was special and a nice way to finish a week at the CES full of touristy crap.  Our waiter told us that at the next table was Mrs. Ted and Mr & Mrs. Mack of the UNLV arena fame.  He also told us that Rollie Fingers comes in whenever he wants duck.

So, a nice choice off the strip if you are looking for a place the locals go to.  About five minutes from the airport too.
great date night place.  I would highly recommend.  Fresh seasonal menu and knowledgeable staff.  Worth a visit!

I absolutely loved this restaurant. Five star food and five star service.

I work in this area and have noticed this restaurant on visits to the Starbuck's next door. People at work said it was good, but I'm not typically looking for dinner spots in this area. Well, tax time came and we had an evening appointment down the street. If my husband had to leave work at a decent hour for our appointment then I was definitely making him take me to dinner. :)

Since I didn't know how long our appointment would last I didn't make a reservation. This was no problem at all for an early dinner and we were seated right away. The restaurant didn't start to fill up until around 7. 

Our sweet waitress greeted us right away and ran over the specials with us as well. She was very attentive with help from other servers as well. We were checked on regularly and our plates were cleared quickly. They did so without being obtrusive or rushing service.

The bread basket included several types of bread, all delicious. I started with the Arugula salad. The individual flavors were nice, but I didn't love the citrus dressing. My husband started with the Oysters, Rockefeller style and really enjoyed it.

My entrée was the star of the show. I had the Seared Sea Scallops. The scallops were perfectly prepared and seasoned nicely. The whole dish came together so well. I loved the sautéed spinach and orange sauce around the scallops. The mashed potatoes were creamy and flavorful with a nice large portion. The mixed vegetables had a truly nice mix of vegetables that were all prepared well with a nice amount of seasoning. My entrée was incredible and a very generous portion. 

My husband had the special which was Elk which was served with a delicious sauce on top, rice and mixed vegetables on the side. I normally don't like elk, but this was prepared in a way that I really enjoyed. The elk had a nice seasoned crust and the meat was tender and flavorful. The sauce on top paired perfectly. My husband also loved his entrée and said he enjoyed the vegetables on the side!

Even though I should have passed on dessert I just couldn't pass it up. Every dessert option sounded amazing and there was only one boring option (crème brulee). Everything else was interesting. The chocolate peanut butter pie was perfectly rich. The peanut butter was very rich, but the chocolate toned it down perfectly. The honeycomb on the top was very unique and definitely added something to the flavor. The lime tart didn't hold back on tang and the lemon curd on the side was refreshing.

This was one of those meals where I left wanting to recommend this restaurant to everyone I know.

How did we find this wonderful restaurant? We turned left at the Strip as we were on our way home via Ambrose and Joshua Tree. This great find is a real American cuisine restaurant that we will put on our Vegas list. If you live in the area, you are in luck.

The menu, which you can see and see the gallery for, is on their website. They have a wide range of choices of Chef Wes Kendrick's versions of your favorites, but with a twist that may make you smile. We had lunch.

I had the Mac & Cheese Gratinee, which you would think is redundant, but this is the kind of redundancy that makes gratinee a perennial favorite. Chef tells me he chooses the cheeses he uses by their melting characteristics. For me, that was melt in the mouth. Yum. It is accompanied by a lovely cucumber/tomato/onion salad, light and vinegary and just the right balance for the gratinee.

DH had the Spinach Chef's salad, and it arrived prettily presented, and he was happy that everything in it was so fresh. Since he is a wonderful salad maker at home, I was surprised that he was impressed. I know what I'll be seeing coming out of our home kitchen. As I say, only steal from the best.

I ordered a rye and ginger ale to start, and I find it is hard to find my favorite lunch drink at restaurants. The bartender will know if the bar has rye, but most waiters think rye is bread, and for some, you have to spell it. So...I got bourbon. When the hostess came over to see if we had questions, I pointed out to her that the order was wrong. She immediately brought me what I had ordered, and told me to keep the bourbon, too. I think I will work on recycling that bourbon. lol DH will be driving, so I planned to take a nap. How convenient.

The restaurant is light, eclectic, and just as charming as the menu and personnel. 

Service was prompt, and it really didn't matter whom you talked to, since they seamlessly share information about what you need. Except for rye.

All in all, this is a really remarkable restaurant, a 21st-century restaurant without all the stuffiness and pretension of restaurants that are not nearly as good. 

We certainly will return.

Not coming back here ever again. My boyfriend and I wanted to try something new so of course we turn to Yelp, find this place rated 4 stars so why not try it out.... Wrong decision.

We were seated immediately, server was very nice.  Waited probably 20 minutes for the halibut special and a trout dish. I can tell you that the main ingredient was oil. Everything was disgustingly oily. We could not even finish or even enjoy our meals that were about $100 total. The only thing that was enjoyable that we ordered was the duck quesadillas, which weren't as oily. 

Staff vibe, the only nice person was our server. Who seemed like he was the only person working there that night. Sure we came in an hour before closing, but I don't think that gives staff an excuse to not being attentive to guests.  First off, we witnessed a staff member drinking a beer on the job while behind the bar. Also witnessed a different server having her employee meal... With a glass of wine (in the dining room by the bar). Don't get me wrong, I love to have a drink or two but they didn't even bother to hide it or enjoy their drinks not in front of the guests. That is just unacceptable.

Bottom Line-- I was interested but not impressed.

Lunch is busy!!! If you are coming here on a weekday for lunch I recommend calling if you're a group of 5 or more as small groups are first come first serve and all tables are taken by 12:00pm. Laurie was super nice in taking our reservation and holding the table until we got there.

I'll chalk up mediocre service to the busyness of the place at lunch. It takes a while to order food because it looks like there are only a few servers between 50 plus tables. I recommend looking at the menu online and knowing what you want so you can order your food when you order your beverage. Lunch for the 6 of us took about an hour and a half.

They have a pretty vast selection of lunch-ish items-- quite a few are light and healthy which is appealing. I got the BBQ chicken wrap which was okay. The chicken was a little dry and while the BBQ taste was good.. the wrap was not amazing. I think I enjoyed my potato salad more. I also ate my coworkers garlic biscuit (that came with the soup) and it was pretty good but would've been better warm. 

I'd give this place another shot.. maybe for dinner.. but it's not at the top of my return list anytime soon.

Side Note: Make sure you look at the restroom signs because the men and womens restrooms are not next to each other by the kitchen (those two are both mens rooms). Yup.. learned the hard way...

Always a great experience!

Called just moments before we arrived to set up a reservation, they had tables open and advised to head in. Although the host mentioned this, he then asked if I was celebrating anything...I explained no, but that I was bringing a special lady with me...my mother. 

Shortly after the call we walk in and he had took the short 5 min to set up a table in the back by the window. Now, the table very well may have been open but the fact that the host remembered the call and gave us the choice was a great gesture!

Food was amazing! Tried their 10 year anniversary menu, which they donated a part of the menu price to a local charity. I do quite a bit of philanthropy work on the side, and this is always good to see...locals helping locals.

I had the Duck Confit Quesadilla as an appetizer...asked the server to chose the entree with either the Lobster Mac and Cheese or the Blackened Flat Iron Steak. He brought the steak, perfectly cooked! Finally for desert I had the Brownie Sundae.

Service is always spot on, from the host to the waiters to the bussers.

I recommend everyone try this restaurant, great high dollar food for a reasonable dollar price!

Can't wait to go back!

We had the wild mushroom pizza it was excellent and we also had chicken and pasta which really good desert also great the only thing our server was just o k not much of a personality but that wouldn't stop me from coming back the quality of the food top notch.                                                           My daughter lives there and friends had told her about it so we had to try and we will be back

Excellent innovative New American cuisine in decent portions, with great flavors. I loved the prosciutto wrapped fig salad, and the rack of pork was cooked just right.  The atmosphere is upscale casual and the service spot-on.  This is one of the best off-strip restaurants in LV.

I love this place and the food is great unfortunately when not sitting at the bar or in the bar area service is kind of hit and miss.  We went for lunch on Tuesday, was excited to hear they had Italian Wedding soup so I ordered that to start and the roasted chicken for my lunch.

My wife ordered the fish.  Needless to say our food eventually came and no soup.  Our server was not even aware that the soup never came which to me is odd, the place is not real large and at the time we got there, it was a good 30 minutes before the lunch rush.

As I said we love this place, it would have been a strong 4 maybe even 5 stars if we would have gotten our order right.

Also bread was never offered to us which is something we look forward to here.  So all in all, the food we ordered was good, I just wish we would have gotten everything we ordered, maybe next time.

Food was absolutely amazing and the service was top notch.   I work close to here but have never stopped in for dinner.   I wad so glad that I did!  I will be frequenting this establishment in the future.   An absolute gem of a find!

This was my 4th or 5th trip back, however it had been a few years. Still serving a very eclectic menu, that includes very good service and an excellent wine list. We thought the food  tasted very  good but not great  especially when you consider that during dinner the main entrees are priced at the high end.  
And at this range you have numerous other  choices within 15 miles that in my opinion
might be a better alternative.  Still, if you have not been there, give it a shot...
Ciao. OH....So they closed without any notice.....That says it all...

Somewhat small but definitely comfortable. The parking situation is a little funky because the restaurant is located in a business park with major Aristocrat building so lunch time gets pretty busy. But the food was great and server was attentive. At the end of the meal they'll pack up your leftovers for you if you want to take them home. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I'd go back.

This is a gem of a place away from the hype of the Strip.  We came here for lunch, and although it's a rather bistro/cafe type place it is very clean, basic and yet warm and cozy too. But what shines here is the food.  The menu is varied and lots of choices from smaller plates to full entrees.  My dining companions had personal pizzas and looked delicious, fresh ingredients and creative.  I had a more basic Ruben sandwich.  It was perfect, meat was tender and the dressing just right.  I had a side of cole slaw, also excellent.

If you're in Las Vegas and have a car, come here!  It is worth it.
This restaurant is very classy and the service and food is amazing! I had the Mac and white cheese and it was delicious! Love this place!

Fancy little place near business buildings on warm springs.  I personally think Vegas needs more of these hidden gems throughout the valley.  The food was decent, i ordered the crab cakes and coworker ordered the salmon.  Both were prepared very well, the crab cakes were perfectly size and contained a good amount of real crab meat.  Its hard to make salmon taste like anything else but salmon, if that even makes sense but this place made the outer layer extra crispy and seasoned it very well.

Normally I'd give this place a 4 stars but it was a bit over priced which is then turns into a mediocre restaurant.

This is a very special restaurant. My husband and I always take our special friends and family here for a divine meal. From the moment you walk in the door and Tony greets you and seats you. Then, if you are truly blessed, Janina will be your server. If there was a contest for best server anywhere, she would be the winner. Just perfect at all she does, from how she knows all the specials, and describes them so well. Last Saturday night, we were with a party of 9 ranging in age from 28 to 74! Everyone said they had the best meal ever. I had the beef tenderloin and it was divine. Others had the leg of lamb, duck and a special mac and cheese. Chef Wes is an amazing chef and we are always impressed with his menu's! Service is impeccable!
It's always our go to restaurant, a bit of heaven

This is the former Wild Sage with many of the same menu items.   My wife's entree this evening was char-broiled prime beef tenderloin with roasted potatoes and veggies. I opted for the seared Maine scallops with sauted spinach, potato puree and orange glazed veggies. Everything, including service was good, but a whisker short of expectations given the price.

Took my lunch group toTable 34 today. Great service, delicious food. We had 2 tables of 8 and no one had the same dish. What a variety of salads, soups, sandwiches, pizza's, and entree's. NO complaints and that is so hard to find in a lunch group like mine. This was a great day. Thanks. Most of the group had never been here except me so I was delighted to share this "gem" of Las Vegas with them.

This was my first time at Table 34.  Upon entry, I was so surprised on how refreshing the simplified but classy New York look impressed me.

Seating was very gracious as was all the staff.  The surprise and impressions only grew when I looked at the menu and I had to be sure I wasn't in the Theater District!  Outstanding menu choices in every category!  

The waiter was extremely helpful with all of these delicious sounding choices along with some daring specials!  We ordered and we were really taken aback by the superb fine quality of the food and service.  Tastes I haven't enjoyed in a long time!  This place is a must on everyone's dinner schedule!

As the number one Business Broker in Nevada, you may rest assured that I have eaten in and sold many many restaurants in Las Vegas.  Table 34 was such a high quality surprise to me.  Again, I insist everyone reading this review go to Table 34!

Ed Smith

While what I ordered was pretty tasty. I think I'm just irritated overall. The menu had a broad selection. I chose a special - Alaskan Halibut. At $38, I figured there would be a non-menu side salad I could get as an accompaniment or to trade what the special came with for a salad. I only could select from the menu salads which was $8 minimum. Like I said, the food was good. I just expected to have been given more options for what I paid.
What a great place.  A fine dining experience/atmosphere even for lunch.  Casual but upscale.  The bison burger was awesome.  The service was attentive but not rushed.
Ordered a cornbeef rueben.. and its bomb.. cant go wrong with this for lunch. :) also comes with free bread.. :)

I'm trying not to let the fact that this is the only decent restaurant within a 2 square mile radius (as well as the only decent place I can walk to from work), but I'm pretty sure I'm going to fail.

It's the only decent place to walk to from work!  That alone is worth four stars.  The salads and the seafood chowder are awesome!!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Off the strip, intimate, service that feels fine dining and reasonable prices. The food quality and service are always top notch. The ribs, macaroni with panchetta and peas, and the beet salad are great. I'd also recommend their butternut squash ravioli and any of their specials, they are always a step above the normal menu, which is always great. I cannot rave enough about this restaurant. My husband and I have been coming here since we were dating, 6 years ago.

I love this locally-owned restaurant.  Chef Kendrick is so talented.  You get a perfect balance of comfort that's been jazzed up with very high- quality ingredients and fresh spins on the traditional.  

Service is spot on.  High-end without being stuffy. I brought my daughters for lunch and was in the middle of an all adult, business lunch crowd. No kids menu but Chef was happy to modify both my daughter's dishes to their tastes.  

The Mediterranean pizza was killer. Bountifully loaded with artichokes, olives and fresh ricotta dollops. The bacon and gouda pizza with spinach and mushrooms, my daughter ordered,  was satisfying and comfort food without being heavy.  

Looking forward to our next visit.

So I have been frequenting this restaurant since it was "Wild Sage" and it never disappoints!  For the veggies, they make an amazing butternut squash ravioli with walnut sauce.  Every time I have it, it  gets better and better.  The meat lover had the BBQ ribs that literally feel off the bone.  He enjoyed the ribs so much that he asked to speak to the chef to give his compliments!  He said the ribs rivaled the best he had in Memphis, home of BBQ. Now the desserts were huge in size and yummy in taste. One person ordered the sundae and loved it! Another ordered the creme brûlée, which was also amazing and  I had the cherry granola square with ice cream, which was delicious!   If you are looking for good food, at a fair price and off the Strip, then head to this restaurant and be pleasantly pleased!

Note: it is a little tricky to find so use your gps. (4 miles from the Strip). It is next to a Starbucks on Warm Springs Rd.

Have you ever been set up on a bad blind date? One where your friend swears that the other person is attractive and that you'll have a ton in common, only to find out that said date is slightly overweight, balding and into LARPing? 

That's how I feel about Table 34. Very few dining experiences have elicited such a negative response in my book.

Probably the most offensive thing about this restaurant is the uninspired menu and ridiculous prices for the food on it. I was told that this would be strip-quality meals, only half the price. Granted, many of the food on the strip is expensive, but the Table 34 prices aren't much different. $25 for meatloaf? $30 for trout? I don't pay that much for dinner in the Bay Area, that's for sure.

To top it off, the food isn't very good. Not sure why I ordered it, but the shrimp pasta I ordered tasted like something you'd get in a cafeteria, just some limp angel hair pasta with shrimp and heavy red sauce. Seriously, a home economics class could have made something just like it. My Mom's sole was slightly better and my brother really enjoyed his ribs, so not all was lost.

The two stars are for the service. Our waiter was extremely nice, especially when our entrees didn't come out at the same time. There was a small snafu in the kitchen and he didn't want the food that was ready to go cold. Very thoughtful and honest.

Bottom line: there are better, more affordable places to eat in Vegas. Table 34 is an overpriced Applebee's with less flair.

Just had an early dinner there. Have to say it was pretty bad. I was really excited to have a great dinner! I knew it would be a little pricy but its worth it if the food is good. The service was very good and the wait staff were very pleasant. The food on the other hand was way over priced and not very tasty. I had the ribs (1/2 rack or so) that had zero flavor. None. No smoke, spice or seasoning. They were coated in a BBQ sauce that I really couldn't taste. They were also cooked differently. Like they had been boiled or something. No texture. Like pot-roast meat. The ribs were served on "Cajun" fries. The fries were just the run of the mill frozen variety that we've all had a million times. Every restaurant serves them. As for the "Cajun" part? I guess they had seasoning salt on them. No Old Bay or anything fancy like that. For $30 everything should have been homemade. Honestly, McDonalds would have been better for 10% of the price. Next time I will get a McRib. Very disappointing!

Overall stellar food! It's kind of odd that it's connected to a Subway in a strip mall but who really cares. My wife ordered a wild mushroom pizza that she couldn't finish, I had ribs that literally fell off the bone (never touched my knife, I swear!) and we had a beef satay appetizer that had a red wine reduction and crispy fried onions. If i'm on death row they may have to package some of those up for my last meal.

My wife was happy to find a great wine selection. The service was very upscale and attentive. I can say that it was a very pleasant experience. The bill was a tad hefty but it's not like they hide their prices. Overall it's a VERY nice place for a date or usefull if you want to take your wife out because you did something stupid.

So I hear...

Great neighborhood restaurant!

I had the stuffed chicken and it was fantastic!
The bartender (marsha) is a little cranky, but she makes a good drink:-)
Great food with nice outdoor seating. I had the roasted vegetable salad which was excellent. Definitely will be going back during my month long stay in Vegas.

As a road warrior, frequent traveler, it's always nice to find a good restaurant on the fly.... I would highly recommend this spot for a great lunch or dinner. 

Be aware, they open at 11, but the manager was so nice! We rattled the locked doors and she came and let us in even though it was 10:30! Very nice. We were seated and well taken care of until the wait staff was ready to start serving. 

They have excellent pizza and my business partner had a great pot pie. I would recommend the crispy bacon, gouda, and mushroom pizza. It was awesome! 

It seems hard to find a nice place to sit down and have lunch in that part of Las Vegas, so if you find yourself in the area try this place out.

Update, I found this gem on yelp!

Located south of McCarran International Airport, one might say that Table34 is a bit out of the way for locals, let alone tourists, but that has not stopped the restaurant co-owned by Chef Wes Kendrick and his sister Laurie from serving the people of Las Vegas for over 17 years, the restaurant originally known as Wild Sage Café continuing to present delicious American Cuisine in a relaxed, yet elegant environment.

Occupying a lengthy footprint at 600 East Warm Springs Road, technically part of a strip-mall but made to feel far nicer by way of a patio and corner-pocket with big windows bathing the space in light, those entering Table34 by way of the front doors will likely find themselves greeted by Laurie or the restaurant's longtime General Manager before being led to one of several tables in a room lined with Wine bottles, mirrors, wood and yellow, the front of house team featuring captains as well as back-servers pleasant and accommodating, though clearly used to dealing with diners that need everything spelled out for them.

Going above and beyond what is necessary of a neighborhood place in terms of sourcing, the local Farmer's Markets providing much of the produce while proteins are Certified Prime or Safe Harbor Fresh as relates to Fish, it was with soft Beverages poured and Wine declined that four guests sat down for a business dinner, the nightly specials all quite tempting which led to eleven plates over three courses sent out over the span of just over two-hours.

Rooted in the concept of 'California Cuisine' in the late nineties, Chef Kendrick coming from the Golden State to join his sister who was then working at Spago in the Forum Shops in 1999, it was after a bit of conversation that the first of two Bread Baskets was delivered along with cold Butter, the Garlic Focaccia and Cranberry-Walnut Bread both reminiscent of the quality offered at Wolfgang Puck's Flagship while the White Rolls were unfortunately a bit dry, shredding as the Butter was added but decent enough later for sopping up sauces.

Serving both weekday lunch and dinner from 5:00 until 9:30pm Tuesday through Saturday, a Happy Hour menu providing some good deals from 4:30 until 6:00 at the bar, those looking to best experience some of Wes' long-time classics would be well served to select one of the Chef's non-GMO Whole Wheat Crust Pizzas offered with a variety of toppings, the Bacon and Gouda Pie featuring a light char with Mushrooms and wilted Spinach but no Sauce while the Quail Salad and Duck Confit Quesadilla spoke of a Chef willing to challenge more conventional diners, the former downright delicious with the crispy skinned bird still juicy and tender while the latter was a little sweet, but still rich enough that the confit Leg would not be mistaken by anyone as Chicken.

Certainly not one to bash Chicken, a personal favorite that often serves as a standard by which a kitchen can be judged in terms of its execution, Table34 offers the bird as either an Herb-roasted Entrée or under a section listed as "Pastas & Pizzas," the six sizable Ravioli appropriately priced at $21 for tender noodles stuffed with ground Breast in an elegant vegetal broth while the Half-Duck and nightly special Wild Boar each hovered around $30 for an amount of meat that would cost double on Las Vegas Boulevard, the golden-skinned Fowl nicely paired to Rice Pilaf that still had a lot of give while the medium-rare Loin was tender and moist despite the lean Meat and very good bite-for-bite with the sweet Cherry Sauce and savory Stuffing.

Making every Dessert save for the Ice Cream in-house, an impressive display even when compared to several of the Strip's best restaurants, it was on the Waitress' suggestion that the decision was made to go all-in on five choices as an apology for Club Soda being spilled all over one guest some thirty-minutes prior, the Lime Tart and Lemon Cheesecake just the things for someone searching for a fresh and vibrant flavor to close out the evening while the silky Chocolate-Peanut Butter Pie with Honeycomb is rich without being too heavy, the same to be said of a daily special Waffle topped in Vanilla Ice Cream and reduced Strawberry-Rhubarb while the "Really Big Warm Chocolate Brownie Sundae" is the sort of dish best shared beneath a Whipped Cream, Sauce and two big scoops of McConnell's Ice Cream.

***1/2: A bit spendy for a local's spot, though no moreso than Ferraro's or Bob Taylor's Ranch House, Table 34 offers classic American cooking from a Chef going above and beyond in terms of ingredient sourcing, the menu straight-forward enough to please those celebrating a special event that might normally be spent at a chain while still offering plenty of interesting options for those who consider a meal at Spago to be typical weekend stuff.

Table 34 is always tasty!  Good selection of items on the menu.  I've been for happy hour and dinner in the past, but finally went for lunch.  The Rueben sandwich was perfect with the homemade potato chips.  Steak salad, a perfect healthy protein lunch.  Vegetable soup, Delicious!  Their pizzas are good too.  They have an excellent chef who you will sometimes see out in the restaurant always with a warm smile.  Always a nice experience without going over the top.  Good prices too.

Lovely lunch with a friend. I had the beet goat cheese salad and they added some greens for me . Delicious ! My friend had the prime rib steak salad with horseradish/blue cheese and that was very good. Lovely server, nice atmosphere . No time for dessert, but I will definitely return and try them!

Enjoyed our family lunch , three of us ordered the Scottish Salmon w/buttered lemon dill sauce and they loved it and I ordered the pot pie w/ side salad (was worried it wouldnt be enough) but was more than enough. It had a sort of sweeter taste, not salty and not a thick gravy, i was glad with my choice. We ordered two desserts to share, chocolate Peanut butter pie and chocolate flourless cake. Both were very good and rich of course.

I'm giving this 3 stars because the staff is great. And in the service industry it's about the staff. That said, in the restaurant story it's also about menu design, food quality, creativity--and by today's standards, artistry.  The menu and preparation at Table 34 are so-so. The shrimp and avo salad was drenched in dressing, making it overly acidic and a chore to consume (and it was consumed only because I was ravenous after a 5 hr drive from LA.) Okay, as mentioned, I'm from LA, which even the NYTimes begrudgingly admits is cooking up some of the best dining in the nation (thus stealing/sharing the crown from/with NYC) so my senses are spoiled. And mind you, I'm not dining only in LA's top eateries...but day to day strip mall fare is creative--and yes, often artistic. But I digress. Table 34 has potential. The staff is great. The vibe is okay. Now if it can just get some creativity going it will soar. I plan to visit again since I'm moving here. Will update.

This restaurant's food used to be excellent. Went there a few days ago and things changed dramatically. Portions are smaller and prices are larger. My husband and I ordered the 'Crispy Fried Artichoke Hearts' for an appetizer. They used to be fantastic...sadly they were smaller and stringy. We then ordered the 'Seared Sea Scallops' at $34.00 per plate because we've had them before. We don't mind spending good money for good food, but when the Scallops arrived, they were much smaller than they used to be and rubbery. Sorry, we used to enjoy coming here but after this experience, not anymore.

We have been coming to this neighborhood restaurant since it was called by its former name of Wild Sage. Table 34 rivals any casino fine dining without the hassle of the strip or the high prices. One of the first keepers was the Butternut Squash Soup. Tonight I had the Shrimp and Lobster Bisque that was delicious and had the best croutons! I also had the layered eggplant with peppers, marinara sauce, and mozzarella cheese. Tino and his assistants have been our servers several times and are very attentive. We raved about the Salted Caramel Chocolate Chip Sundae and he told us the ice cream is McConnells from Santa Barbara. I love it when a restaurant isn't afraid to tell you their secrets. My final reason for returning is they serve Justin Cab! I've never had a bad meal at Table 34.

Another great place!!!!

It's kinda heard to find, it's in a small strip mall where there's a Starbucks. But the other issue they have is at night they leave the shades down so it's pitch black and you can't tell if it's opened or closed. Very bad management! Pull up your shades, we almost left b/c we thought it was closed.  We went on a Saturday night, had a great waiter who was very attentive, good thing as there weren't many people there and our bill was like $120.

Lots of nice wine to choose from and our waiter brought us several to sample until he could sell us on getting booze with our meal :) we were happy to accommodate!

One big thing: THE CRAB CAKES. Now I love seafood, but this is by far the best crab cake I've ever had. I've never gone to take a second bite of something when I realize my mouth is uncontrollably watering!  It's to die for.  Please make a crabcake on a salad lunch menu item, as well as, a crab cake dinner.  The lemon caper aioli, embarrassing to admit, but we were dunking our bread in it once the crab cake was devoured!

Oysters-Kusshi-amazing

If you're a local go to this place, it's great but the location is not the best!

see pix

After picking up a friend from the airport we were looking for a place close by to eat, we had a 3 hour window to eat and get back to the airport to drop him off for his next flight.

The original idea was Bachi Burger, however, following our last meal there we figured it would be better to give the place more time to get the kinks out as three semi negative reviews (the food is great, the service side needs help) in 3 weeks would just seem a little mean spirited.

So a quick check on Yelp gave us Table 34, yes it's certainly different from Bachi, but good food is good food.

The location is interesting, as noted by Shari S, but being across the parking lot from Aristocrat Gaming probably isn't a bad idea, at least as far as working lunches are concerned.

Let's get this out of the way, the service was good, no complaints in any way to be had.

The food ranges from comfort (meatloaf) to Oven Roasted Half Duckling with Wild Rice Pilaf & Cherry-Port Wine Reduction, nothing really stretching the palette, but, if done well it can certainly be a home run.

Well in our case, it was a home run, a couple of small miscues, but even our friend who is a total foodie left happy.

For the starters, I went with the Manhattan chowder, this was probably the weakest of the dishes we had tonight, don't get me wrong, it was good, but, maybe a little watery for my taste.

My wife had the  tomato and buffalo mozzarella which was excellent, a high grade of mozzarella was used along with just the right amount of balsamic. 

Our friend had the prosciutto wrapped figs, these were also well done, though honestly I do prefer Fire Fly's take on this dish, again it was good, but personal taste must rule.

For our entrees.

Myself and our friend had one of the specials of the day, baby back ribs, certainly not gourmet food, but a dish that is all to easy to make a complete mess off.

Well I am happy to say, the ribs themselves were excellent, perfectly cooked, the dish came with Cajun fries, on both dishes the "Cajun" part was weak, there was a little spice, but I was expecting a little more kick.

Of course the other part of a rib dish is the sauce, in this case it was very good, the taste was, while not BBQ, it fitted the dish very well, again though, it did seem a little watery, but it was certainly something I would recommend and order again without hesitation.

My wife had the salmon, again a simple dish done right, she also said the cauliflower puree was excellent.

The portion sizes for all dishes were large, you will not leave here hungry.

For dessert, the three of us split a creme brulee, another simple dish that can be killed by a bad chef, this one however was the highlight of the dinner, perfectly prepared.

So in all, a great simple dinner, made with good ingredients, prepared very well, with good service in a nice atmosphere, at a reasonable price, something that is rare here in Vegas and it will certainly be a restaurant we will be eating at again. 

I will also say, there was a group there celebrating a young (5-6) girls birthday, the wait staff showed their skills, they certainly made the young lady feel special, without interfering with the tables seated around them, a big thumbs up.

Actually, whoever trained this staff, please go help Bachi Burger find their way.

I had theirs crab cakes (2 half-dollar size) that were alright but nothing special. Their bone in filet was over-seasoned and was cooked medium-well (I ordered medium-rare). Service was good and attentive. Customers were majority cotton-tops (senior citizens) and some middle aged folks. Overall, not worth the price for what you get.
Loved this place. Exceptional food, unexpected. Great servers and host. Off the beaten path and not crowded. Excellent new find!

Went here for a lunch during my PMP class, I liked it but it was too expensive for just a lunch.

They had king crab on special, and had a crab bisque soup which was excellent, very flavorful and delicious.  I also had the chicken caesar which I could not finish.  The caesar wasn't special or remarkable in any way.  Soup, salad, and iced tea came out to like 17 or 18 bucks, with tip over 20ish.  

Not a place I'd go regularly due to the price but I liked it.

The atmosphere is nice here, it's definitely on the fancy side. The food was very good. We had gotten the Oysters on a Half Shell with Cocktail Sauce, which was delicious. Then we had ordered the corn chowder, which was delicious. I love corn chowder. We also got bacon wrapped prawns, which were quite crispy. Finally, we also ordered the Prosciutto and Mission Fig Pizza with Maytag Blue Cheese, and changed the Blue Cheese to something else.
