I can't remember what, but they were more than willing to make the change, and it came out pretty good. It is a pricy restaurant, but it does have good food to make up for it.
Way overpriced. $31 for meatloaf? Go to Hash House at M Resort instead.

Ok this place is awsome. Good food and good ambiance, but ai have to say that the best part of the experience was our waitress!!
Sorry but I cant remember her name, but she was there on Tuesday night may 2/2017. Everything she explain to us and the time she took to take care of us was amazing. I will go with five stars but my pizza was a bit soggy and they need to have a drinks menú.
But overall I recommend. Thanks!
Poor service, put in a corner table and forgotten, over cooked lamb.  We ordered medium rare and got well done. The wine was good.  Next time we are going to Todd's instead.

Great spot.  We had just gotten in off a long flight on Christmas Eve and we were ready for a good meal.  The food and service were outstanding.   Owners made it a point to stop and speak to us multiple times.

We will definitely be back.

We've been meaning to try this place for ages and finally made it over.  I had  the caprese salad as a starter and my husband had clam chowder.  Both excellent.  I ate the ribs (not on the menu but they have them "every night," according to the server), and husband had the meatloaf.  Both were awesome, portions large and we had to pack half up to take home.

I love that the service of this place was just the right mix of attentive and relaxed.  Meaning - I felt tended to but not rushed.  The was an appropriate wait between starters and main dishes, which was great -  I HATE being rushed in that aspect.  We'll be back.

This is such a cute little hidden gem. Very romantic inside. The food was very delicious and the service was excellent! One of the things I love about Vegas,... any night can be a special & romantic date night! Such a beautiful restaurant... I didn't expect it to be so delicious! We ordered the special of the night; the ribeye steaks, they came with the most delicious cognac peppercorn sauce! For appetizers, the shishito peppers & fried artichokes as an appetizer. Those are both very difficult appetizers to find! define. And, they just happened to be my favorites! And, for dessert I said I wanted the lemon tart or crème brûlée. But, when I got back from the restroom... it turns out he ordered both of them! And, a 2nd lemon drop martini! Oh my! Definitely give this place a try! I was extremely impressed!

I really have enjoyed both of my dining experiences at Table 34. 
The crowd is a bit on the older side, but It still has a fun lively atmosphere. 

We always settle in with few bottles of wine and no one has seemed to care that my dinning partners and I are still there well after everyone else as finished there desserts and gone home for the evening! 

The servers are very attentive and knowledgeable about the wine selection. Great menu & wine selection with decent prices.

It's a nice neighborhood spot!

This was a very nice smaller establishment. We were staying at the Doubletree, ( slightly tempted to just walk over to Applebee's), but instead looked for something local. We are so glad we did! It is within walking distance , but we drove the short 3 min up the hill. Greeted warmly and seated immediately on a Wednesday late night. Bread and water was brought out right away. Next greeted by our server who later offered great advice for a choice of the Mediterranean Pizza. Arugula salad was fresh and lightly tossed with a fresh vinaigrette. Our server continued to be watchful and made sure we had a nice evening. I would highly recommend this restaurant choice to anyone within a reasonable drive. We will definitely keep it in mind for future dining in Las Vegas.

Aww with a name like Table 34 I could only imagine the food is almost as bland as the name.   No problem, I like to give small mom and pop Restaurants a try.  I enter with a little skepticism as I should not to be greeted and seated, but instead wait, and wait and wait to finally be greeted by Lori who seemed irritated with her half smile and very plain demeanor.  She seats us and we wait and wait and wait...to finally have a server approach us who doesn't speak a lick of understandable plain ENGLISH.  Now I know were in Vegas and it's a very diverse place with a lot of different people and cultures, but this is an Americanized restaurant right?? Wrong!!!  The food I ordered was the pork chop that was so fatty I didn't finish it, that came with a side of Chipotle' mashed potatos that were so flavorless with taste I dumped salt on them to wash them down with my overpriced beverage.  Also had a side of the mixed veggies that were so oily and drenched in a butter oil that I couldn't eat.  Ok maybe it's an off night no biggie.  Onto dessert.  The ice cream was great but I can tell it's not homemade but rather ordered from a vendor, no biggie I ate all of it. 1 star for that.  Where I start to slowly decline my stars is the mediocre food and plate presentation.  Strike 2, waitress was short, rude, and didn't explain the menu well and I sensed irribility when I had questions, strike 3.  Strike 4 is how the waitresses and waiters glare at customers and walk away and snap towels at each other laughing and talking in Spanish laughing at God knows what?  Maybe they weren't laughing at me directly but it's just uncomfortable and sets off a bad vibe for such a nice restaurant with so much potential and decor.  Last strike is seeing CHEF WES grab a beer and pop it open and take a drink and walk back to the Kitchen like he doesn't care what's going on in his Restaurant.  Shame on you Chef Wes for drinking on the job, even if it's your Restaurant don't drink while working and preparing orders while customers are in your building eating food!  Completely unprofessional and I will NEVER be back or recommend.   Also if I hear Lori talk about how she's such an independent strong woman who's made it in life one more time I'm going to vomit my Salted Caramel ice cream all over the table.  I guess having a very small unknown restaurant with flavorless food and rude staff who can't speak English and make customers feel at home is making it in America.  Thank you Donald Trump...but hey, this is all just locker room talk right???

Normally I'm not one to write reviews. I personally believe businesses deserve to hear it from a Customer first and have the opportunity to right any wrongs than to read it via negative review but I realized that after speaking to their "manager" that this place is a joke. Stranded in a random business area, I wanted to try this place because it was listed as one of the best in Las Vegas. Best of poor sanitary conditions, lack of professionalism, and common sense? Probably. I ordered a scallop salad which had a hair on it. I brought it to the attention of the server who then flagged down another. In a short amount of time the attention of one server became a council of 5 or 6 servers debating on the hair. Really? Right next to my table? As if taking maybe five steps to the kitchen to discuss the situation wasn't common sense. I requested to speak to the manager to point out how uncomfortable it made me feel that their front of house staff would act in such a way and not in the privacy out back. The manager then came out, apologized but had the nerve to say "just so you know the cook that makes the salad is nearly bald." As if that matters? My hair is dyed blonde. Do you think that makes me feel comforted that this hair didn't come from a cook? I wouldn't even eat my own hair what makes you think I care? Instead of just handling the situation properly and understanding that my concern was towards the front of house staff conduct. She proceeds to say "oh you know mistakes happen." Got it. So not only did you not understand my concern. You choose to brush it off. I wonder how the health department feel about your "mistakes happen." Your "I'm sorry" loose apology doesn't mean anything if you can't understand that the issue lies with the front of house staff. Thanks for the lack of care. Absolutely unprofessional and I would never come back here. Save yourself the money anyways. Food is mediocre. Menu for lunch is limited. The worst hospitality from an incompetent manager.

Came here for lunch last week, and it is delicious!

I ordered the Lamb Salad, and it was near perfect.  Lamb was very slightly over cooked, but the flavor was fantastic (ordered medium rare, and got medium).

The bread that they serve is also very good.  It is a type of raisin bread, and is a great way to start the meal.  I think that Table 34 is primarily a lunch spot for businesses, and it serves that purpose really well.

If you like lamb, I can't recommend the lamb salad high enough!

The entire table got different salads, and everyone was very happy.

We're visiting family from out of town and decided this would be a good place for a nice dinner.  Wrong. 
My cousin made reservations and we arrived at our reserved time. We were greeted and seated immediately.  
The waitress, Elena, took our drink orders.  Between us, we ordered a 7&7, prosecco, vodka mule, and a bay breeze. We were informed there was no Smirnoff, which was requested for the bay breeze), and no ginger beer for the mule. Okay. No problem.  
Drinks were brought to us and no mention of taking an appetizer or dinner order was requested. We're now in to almost 30 minutes of being at the restaurant.  We waited... Watched Elena pass by at least five times. Nothing. 
We decided to request the check for our drinks and leave.  When we told her we wanted to close out and why, without even an apology or request for us to stay, she had the audacity to ask if we wanted the change. Really?   We saw her speak to the maitre d' and not long after she brought us the change with major attitude and, of course, no apology. 
When we walked out, silence from the maitre d'.  Not even a "have a nice evening," "we apologize" "go f yourself" nothing!
In a city like this, superior service is typically top notch, but in this case, it was absolutely a big disappointment. 
We were prepared to spend a decent amount of money and instead forced out for the slow and lackluster service.

I came to Table 34 on the recommendation of a colleague who lives in Las Vegas. I had crab cakes for an appetizer and sea bass for dinner. In a word--outstanding. The crab cakes were moist and tasty. But the fish was among the best I've every had, perhaps the best (and I eat a lot of fish). The fish, covered with a delicious sauce with capers, was moist and absolutely wonderful. It was served with mixed vegetables, including carrots and broccolini. These, too, were among the best I've eaten. The service was prompt, professional and attentive. I'm coming here again on my next Las Vegas trip.

I've been coming to Table 34 on a semi/occasional basis for a lil while now.  It is conveniently located near my work, and we have even had it catered in. I have always had great service here; the staff is very friendly and attentive. The food is fresh, beautifully presented, and has great flavor.

Stopped in for lunch on Wednesday. We arrived just after 11:00 and were the first ones there. The menu consists mostly of salads and sandwiches with a couple pizza and pasta options as well. There are several entree salads which I know many would appreciate. 

We went with the albacore tuna melt and the bison burger which was a special for the day. The tuna melt came on rye bread with fries and we chose sweet potato tots for burger. Both were good with us preferring the bison burger. The lettuce, tomato and pickles were garden fresh quality. The burger was also cooked perfectly medium rare. The tuna melt was pretty average, but we enjoyed it. 

Table 34 is in an odd location hidden away in a corporate office park off Warm Springs. The dinner menu does look appealing but the prices seem very high for its location. I would definitely return for lunch or happy hour.

This was a place we've driven by for years. I was looking around on Yelp for ideas where to eat and this popped up. 
Read the menu and reviews. So we ate lunch there today. It was very good. Going to go back for dinner soon. The dining room is nicely decorated. The bar area is small but good for a pre dinner drink or happy hour. 
The staff was friendly, efficient. They didn't hover. I had the BLTA with salad. Very tasty. My husband had the pastrami 
on rye with fries. 
We would both order the same items again. There was a lot of ideas that sounded really good on the menu for lunch. Dinner looked even better.

Since I work in the area, I have had this place on my radar for ages, but never got around to going for lunch until recently for a team lunch. The place is really, roomier than I expected and very airy and light. The service was extremely attentive and friendly. 

I started with a green iced tea and some of their complimentary bread with butter. They have a pretty extensive lunch menu but I decided on the linguini with chicken, spinach and tomatoes in garlic sauce. The pasta was very fresh, I was loving that and the portion was incredibly generous. I ended up having plenty to take home with me for a second lunch the next day. 

We rounded out our meal with several desserts to share around the table. We had creme brulee, chocolate peanut butter torte, lime tart and lemon cheesecake. They were all delightful, but my favorites were the lemon cheesecake and lime tart which were really light and delicate with just the right amount of tartness. 

Since I work in the area, I see myself coming here again really soon. It's a little on the expensive side but it's nice for a splurge every once in a while.
